programme.title: Airport
Port lotniczy
Airport
programme.desc:
Airport: Directed by George Seaton, Henry Hathaway. With Burt Lancaster, Dean Martin, Jean Seberg, Jacqueline Bisset. A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0065377/","name":"Airport","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk5NWJkYjItMjA2MC00NThiLWE4NTctOTFlYjcwOTA1YTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0065377/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AaronCapenBanner"},"dateCreated":"2013-09-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Disaster Drama.","reviewBody":"George Seaton directed this massive box-office hit about an busy airport(of course!) threatened not only by a blizzard, but a bomber on one of its planes. All-star cast includes Burt Lancaster, Dean Martin, Jacqueline Bissit, Van Heflin, Maureen Stapleton, and George Kennedy as Joe Patroni, a role he would reprise in the three sequels.

Though long, contrived, and potentially silly, this film still managed to be entertaining in spite of the melodrama, thanks to the good cast of actors who still give it their all(and a wonderful, Academy Award winning performance by Helen Hayes as a chronic "stowaway".)

Though star Burt Lancaster was embarrassed by its success, and despite later spoofing, this holds up as fine escapist fare.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18505,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1970-03-05","keywords":"boeing 707,cockpit,air crew,airport,bomb","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1608826905","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhYWQwZTItZjc1NS00NjUzLThhYmMtZDU4NzMxNThlYjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhYWQwZTItZjc1NS00NjUzLThhYmMtZDU4NzMxNThlYjJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000044/","name":"Burt Lancaster"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001509/","name":"Dean Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001421/","name":"George Kennedy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780833/","name":"George Seaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0368871/","name":"Henry Hathaway"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0119020/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0354150/","name":"Arthur Hailey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780833/","name":"George Seaton"}],"duration":"PT2H17M"}</script><metacontent="

The true story of the Miami Jackson High School chess team which was the first inner city team to win the U.S. National Chess Championship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7870102/","name":"Critical Thinking","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzhiMzM0YTItZjAyOC00NGEzLWE5Y2ItN2E4MGM3MDhkNzY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The true story of the Miami Jackson High School chess team which was the first inner city team to win the U.S. National Chess Championship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7870102/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"A_Different_Drummer"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not Quite "To Sir With Love" (1967)","reviewBody":"A long time ago when he was "the next big thing," John Leguizamo did a 1-man show that picked up rave reviews. programme.title: Als Hitler das rosa Kaninchen stahl
Gdy Hitler ukradł różowego królika
Als Hitler das rosa Kaninchen stahl
programme.desc:
Als Hitler das rosa Kaninchen stahl: Directed by Caroline Link. With Riva Krymalowski, Marinus Hohmann, Carla Juri, Oliver Masucci. A Jewish family had to flee from the Nazis from Berlin. First, they flee to Zurich. From there it goes to Paris and finally to London." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9106672/","name":"Als Hitler das rosa Kaninchen stahl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmNiOWM5NTItNTJiYi00MTAzLThjYzUtOGVmNGJhNjVlYTFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTM5NzYzNTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Jewish family had to flee from the Nazis from Berlin. First, they flee to Zurich. From there it goes to Paris and finally to London.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9106672/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"WinstonNoCGI"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"A poor movie, depicting people with today's attitude set back in time to 1934","reviewBody":"When I saw the flick today, from the very first minutes of the movie I saw people talking and acting like today's people, set into some 1930s stage. I don't know if it's just the bad acting or the bad director that made the movie so implausible to follow.

The actors neither speak or act like people spoke or behaved back in the 1930s.

Within the first 10 minutes the words "Nazi" and "Hitler" were uttered several times - completely omitting that, back then, the true apprehended menace was the local authorities. Back then, the politics wasn't perceived as being the result of just one single mad man. It was a huge and, back then, popular organization that was ruling the country. I haven't read the original book; probably it's written the same way, but if it does, then it's, too, not using the words that have been used back then and written from a retrospective. So to me, this flic is rather a fictional wannabe than a realistic biopic.

Though I admit the film was portraying only a child's view on the situation, from my point of view it is emotionally quite vapid. All the important moments in the film that might have caused the slightest suspense or compassion were left out. Even the situation where the train conductor checks for the family name is depicted like they were just buying a pound of butter.

Which brings me to mention the completely irrelevant and petty musical score. I wouldn't call the few dull notes in the movie a "score" anyway. The musical score didn't at all convey any emotion whatsoever.

The depicted situations all were so nugatory staged and poorly scored, it was often utterly hard to bear. When the family left their mansion at the beginning of the movie I begged for some emotional musical score to convey the loss. But no, why bother viewers with emotion ...

Then, dialogs were often spoken like being read from a text sheet. The intonation was horrible. Important words were hidden in a discharge of words. No pause was disturbing the spate.

The only exception to the cast was the elder woman playing the housekeeper/nanny. She was acting marvellously, conveying emotions from every word and every micromotion. And I felt the actor depicting the son character acting quite authentic.

Finally, I don't quite unterstand why French scenes were subtitled while the Swiss actors (even the children) were to talk German instead of Swiss German. The children even were dubbed. Well, as I wrote before, the flick was implausible to many regards.

For everyone who wants to follow a year in a child's live bothered with some relocations but otherwise living a life everyone else lived back then, they will enjoy the movie. But for everyone else, expecting only a fraction of a quality flick like "Der Engel mit der Posaune", they will certainly be disappointed. To me this film is just a plain subsidied direct-to-video quality level production.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2035,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"genre":["Biography","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"f rated,child protagonist,third reich,refugee,triple f rated","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1828241177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIwMWQ1MTgtNDMwOS00NzAzLTgwMTMtZTg0NDBkMGZhODk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIwMWQ1MTgtNDMwOS00NzAzLTgwMTMtZTg0NDBkMGZhODk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8528150/","name":"Riva Krymalowski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6279295/","name":"Marinus Hohmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3231562/","name":"Carla Juri"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0512862/","name":"Caroline Link"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0248277/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314266/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0504740/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0117697/","name":"Anna Brüggemann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1709313/","name":"Judith Kerr"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0512862/","name":"Caroline Link"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hide and Seek
Siła strachu
Hide and Seek
programme.desc:
Hide and Seek: Directed by John Polson. With Robert De Niro, Dakota Fanning, Famke Janssen, Elisabeth Shue. As a widower tries to piece together his life in the wake of his wife's suicide, his daughter finds solace, at first, in her imaginary friend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0382077/","name":"Hide and Seek","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MDkxNDY4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzE4ODc3._V1_.jpg","description":"As a widower tries to piece together his life in the wake of his wife's suicide, his daughter finds solace, at first, in her imaginary friend.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0382077/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jdesando"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A classic underachiever.","reviewBody":"Maybe Robert De Niro's doctor in Godsend (2004) went to the same medical school of horrors as his Dr. David Callaway in Hide and Seek, this year's De Niro toss away film, from which he deposits his considerable paycheck along with cash from Meet the Fockers. Why he doesn't concentrate his fortune and connections (as Clint Eastwood does) to craft an artful small film that would allow his acting gifts is the only mystery for me from his prolific but arguably spotty career.

Young Emily Callaway (Dakota Fanning) has lost her mother (Amy Irving) to suicide. Psychologist dad moves her to an older, rambling house in the woods in upstate New York to start a new life. Not new are the abundant clichés of the horror film: the suspicious neighbors, whom director John Polson makes as creepy as possible; the questionable sheriff; the doors leading to scares; the mutilated dolls; Emily's imaginary friend, Charlie, who appears to be causing numberless offenses in the house; and knives placed as objects of intrinsic interest; and a vulnerable girl friend, Elizabeth (Elisabeth Shue). I stopped counting, for the film is one extended cliché after another.

The interest for serious filmgoers might be the depiction of the psychological stat after a loss to suicide. Whatever the term might be such as "post-traumatic stress disorder syndrome," the film does a credible job showing how difficult it is for Emily to lead a normal life after the loss of her mother (and for her father as well). While there are echoes of Stephen King (The Shining's "Here's Johnny" comes to mind) and Hitchcock (think shower scene), there is no comparison in quality with those classics. The audience at the preview enjoyed some of the stock shock moments behind the many closed doors. Hide and Seek will titillate horror fans but disappoint discerning film buffs, who look for some believable edge and innovation.

Milton in Paradise Lost expressed the descent from happiness to despair: "Farewell happy fields, Where joy forever dwells: hail, horrors!" Hide and Seek is not a classic horror film; it is a classic underachiever."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83906,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2005-03-09","keywords":"death of pet,psychologist,bathtub,smothered with a pillow,pushed out a window","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hide and Seek (2005)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1286406425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWVkNTliYzMtNDU1Ny00NWJiLTg1YTItODY4YjdiMmM5NTg2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWVkNTliYzMtNDU1Ny00NWJiLTg1YTItODY4YjdiMmM5NTg2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266824/","name":"Dakota Fanning"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000463/","name":"Famke Janssen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0689852/","name":"John Polson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046572/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1324179/","name":"Ari Schlossberg"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

Why he doesn't concentrate his fortune and connections (as Clint Eastwood does) to craft an artful small film that would allow his acting gifts is the only mystery for me from his prolific but arguably spotty career.

Young Emily Callaway (Dakota Fanning) has lost her mother (Amy Irving) to suicide. Psychologist dad moves her to an older, rambling house in the woods in upstate New York to start a new life. Not new are the abundant clichés of the horror film: the suspicious neighbors, whom director John Polson makes as creepy as possible; the questionable sheriff; the doors leading to scares; the mutilated dolls; Emily's imaginary friend, Charlie, who appears to be causing numberless offenses in the house; and knives placed as objects of intrinsic interest; and a vulnerable girl friend, Elizabeth (Elisabeth Shue). I stopped counting, for the film is one extended cliché after another.

The interest for serious filmgoers might be the depiction of the psychological stat after a loss to suicide. Whatever the term might be such as "post-traumatic stress disorder syndrome," the film does a credible job showing how difficult it is for Emily to lead a normal life after the loss of her mother (and for her father as well). While there are echoes of Stephen King (The Shining's "Here's Johnny" comes to mind) and Hitchcock (think shower scene), there is no comparison in quality with those classics. The audience at the preview enjoyed some of the stock shock moments behind the many closed doors. Hide and Seek will titillate horror fans but disappoint discerning film buffs, who look for some believable edge and innovation.

Milton in Paradise Lost expressed the descent from happiness to despair: "Farewell happy fields, Where joy forever dwells: hail, horrors!" Hide and Seek is not a classic horror film; it is a classic underachiever.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83906,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2005-03-09","keywords":"death of pet,psychologist,bathtub,smothered with a pillow,pushed out a window","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hide and Seek (2005)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1286406425","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWVkNTliYzMtNDU1Ny00NWJiLTg1YTItODY4YjdiMmM5NTg2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWVkNTliYzMtNDU1Ny00NWJiLTg1YTItODY4YjdiMmM5NTg2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266824/","name":"Dakota Fanning","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000463/","name":"Famke Janssen"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0689852/","name":"John Polson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046572/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1324179/","name":"Ari Schlossberg"],"duration":"PT1H41M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jestem REN
Jestem REN
programme.desc: Jestem REN: Directed by Patricia Ryczko. With Marta Król, Marcin Sztabinski, Marieta Zukowska, Janusz Chabior. We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that her android self is her own fantasy. She begins to cooperate with the therapy, realizing she will be able to return to her family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11067160/","name":"Jestem REN","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFiNDYxZDQtYzZjOC00NmU5LTllYjEtZjc4MWFhZGRhZTllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzUwOTc4NjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that h","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11067160/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fxflinn"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thought provoking parable of mental illness","reviewBody":"Caught this at the Boston Science Fiction Film Festival in Feb 2020. It's a tidy, well made film that draws you into a family battling the mental illness of the mother, who believes she is a sentient android who has malfunctioned. But maybe she is a human who has constructed an elaborate backstory to hide from the pain of being a person who cannot love and who cannot stop beating her on-the-cusp of manhood son. The material clues suggest we are in our time, not some future echoing the television series "Humans," but we are looking at the world through the eyes of the narrator, the mother, and she sees clues about her android origin everywhere. By the time the movie reaches its conclusion, you've been drawn into the madness, the uncertainty of what is human, what is programming, and profound discomfort for the mom and her interior life. The dedication at the end of the film makes it clear the filmmaker wanted to share his experience with his mother and her struggle. He succeeded. The intimate cinematography is a case study in how closeups and lighting can draw an audience into the interior life of the characters. The actors all do a fine job, particularly Marta Krol in the role of the mother and Marieta Zukowska as her peer, counterpart, alter ego or therapist -- when you are in psychosis, those around you play many roles.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":74,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-03-27","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2067989/","name":"Marta Król"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2029225/","name":"Marcin Sztabinski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2346424/","name":"Marieta Zukowska"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2253296/","name":"Patricia Ryczko"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0734708/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0767135/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0778711/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2253296/","name":"Patricia Ryczko"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Masz na imie Justine
Masz na imię Justine
programme.desc:
Masz na imie Justine: Directed by Franco de Pena. With Anna Cieslak, Arno Frisch, Rafal Mackowiak, Mathieu Carrière. When Polish teenager Mariola is duped by her new boyfriend and sold to a sex-trafficking ring in Germany, she is faced with a choice: die along with her grandmother, or adopt to her new identity as an experienced call-girl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479257/","name":"Masz na imie Justine","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ5MTQ0ODQ3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzkyODI5NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Polish teenager Mariola is duped by her new boyfriend and sold to a sex-trafficking ring in Germany, she is faced with a choice: die along with her grandmother, or adopt to her new identity as an experienced call-girl.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479257/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ocosis"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dark.","reviewBody":"Similar in tone to Lukas Moodysson's Lilja 4-Ever, Masz Na Imie Justine is another study of human trafficking, and the effects this horror has on the soul. Anna Cieslak gives a strong performance as the fated Mariola, a young Polish girl, who's leaves her home looking for a brighter future, but ends up being delivered into the hands of devils.

Cieslak's performance is the strongest part of the movie. As a film it's competently realised, but also feels a little vacuous, although that same feeling works well alongside Cieslak's character, whom understandably is losing her self to the tortures she is forced into.

As with Lilja 4-Ever, Masz Na Imie Justine is an important film, that warns us of the evil that man can inflict, and it is a horror that is sadly all too real.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":479,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-05-10","keywords":"pig,slaughterhouse,toasting with a drink,drinking vodka,male female relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1752088/","name":"Anna Cieslak"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0295823/","name":"Arno Frisch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0533650/","name":"Rafal Mackowiak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0210938/","name":"Franco de Pena"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143581/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121022/","name":"Chris Burdza"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1268993/","name":"Tomasz Kepski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0210938/","name":"Franco de Pena"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

When Polish teenager Mariola is duped by her new boyfriend and sold to a sex-trafficking ring in Germany, she is faced with a choice: die along with her grandmother, or adopt to her new identity as an experienced call-girl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479257/","name":"Masz na imie Justine","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ5MTQ0ODQ3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzkyODI5NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Polish teenager Mariola is duped by her new boyfriend and sold to a sex-trafficking ring in Germany, she is faced with a choice: die along with her grandmother, or adopt to her new identity as an experienced call-girl.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479257/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ocosis","dateCreated":"2020-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dark.","reviewBody":"Similar in tone to Lukas Moodysson's Lilja 4-Ever, Masz Na Imie Justine is another study of human trafficking, and the effects this horror has on the soul. Anna Cieslak gives a strong performance as the fated Mariola, a young Polish girl, who's leaves her home looking for a brighter future, but ends up being delivered into the hands of devils.

Cieslak's performance is the strongest part of the movie. As a film it's competently realised, but also feels a little vacuous, although that same feeling works well alongside Cieslak's character, whom understandably is losing her self to the tortures she is forced into.

As with Lilja 4-Ever, Masz Na Imie Justine is an important film, that warns us of the evil that man can inflict, and it is a horror that is sadly all too real.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":479,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"genre":["Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-05-10","keywords":"pig,slaughterhouse,toasting with a drink,drinking vodka,male female relationship","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1752088/","name":"Anna Cieslak","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0295823/","name":"Arno Frisch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0533650/","name":"Rafal Mackowiak"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0210938/","name":"Franco de Pena"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0143581/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054609/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121022/","name":"Chris Burdza","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1268993/","name":"Tomasz Kepski","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0210938/","name":"Franco de Pena"],"duration":"PT1H37M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:

With Robert Olech, Piotr Glowacki, Cezary Lukaszewicz, Martyna Peszko." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479261/","name":"Rozdroze Cafe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGJjYTU2NWQtZmUzNy00YTA5LWE3NWMtZDUzNzhiYTIyMGQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479261/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"temporarybobi"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well done","reviewBody":"I saw this film in Krakow's Kino Pod Baranami. Film was well done. It depicts the misunderstandings among some young polish provincial people, who have the ambitions to crop up in the new post-communist, re-capitalist society.

While the young women in the film are trying to escape the disconsolately life by either getting know established oldsters or by giving birth to numerous children, the young men decide to rob a bank. Things get wrong, one of the guys flips out and kills four people.

The film is supposed to be based on a true story which has happened for about 3-4 years in Warsaw. The screenplay makes use of many clichés, otherwise film is well done."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":144,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-11-11","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2027064/","name":"Robert Olech"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1644158/","name":"Piotr Glowacki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2021835/","name":"Cezary Lukaszewicz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941829/","name":"Leszek Wosiewicz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941829/","name":"Leszek Wosiewicz"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The East
Ida
programme.desc:
The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Emma_Stewart"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"An outstanding addition to Brit Marling's repertoire","reviewBody":"Since 2011's Another Earth landed at Sundance and nabbed the Special Jury Prize, Brit Marling has quickly cemented herself as one of the most exciting and challenging new talents. When she feels a genre hasn't been explored to its full potential, she takes it further. When she notices women her age are typecast in boring roles, she writes her own. She's a visionary filmmaker with something to say and the talent and ambition to make sure she's heard - her second collaboration with director and co- writer Zal Batmanglij, The East, is no exception, and is perhaps the peak of her already illustrious career so far. 

The film follows Jane Owen (Marling), an undercover security agent, as she leaves behind her doting boyfriend (Jason Ritter) to infiltrate an eco-terrorist group known as The East, who have publicly targeted massive corporations for their covered-up crimes against humans and nature. In between reports to her icy, amoral boss (Patricia Clarkson), Jane slowly grows fascinated with the group, its morals and goals, and its core (Alexander Skarsgard, Ellen Page, Shiloh Fernandez, Toby Kebbell), observing with a mix of horror and infatuation as they execute their violent "jams" on the corporations' key members. 

The East will inevitably draw comparisons to Sean Durkin's Martha Marcy May Marlene because of the subject matter and its ingenue leading lady.The East is not as much of a psychological profile, but there are interesting similarities - like Durkin, Batmanglij and Marling never really villainize or condemn their subects; instead, they make a point of showing the East's appeal. We, the audience, begin to understand why these troubled young people would find solace and purpose in what is essentially a band of guerrilla terrorists, and, in turn, why Jane is so hypnotized by them. It makes for an uncomfortably provocative watch: as we learn more about the characters, their backgrounds, and the corporations' crimes (which are based in fact), it's hard to determine who the "bad guys" are. I saw the film at a festival where Batmanglij gave a short Q&A after and he revealed that he, Marling, and Page had lived with similar groups (without the terrorism) before and were sympathetic with the East's cause, if not their methods. The sympathy shows in the writing and most of the time that's a good thing, but there are times when it gets closer to bias and muddies otherwise brilliant storytelling - but these are blips in the overall outstanding product. 

Marling is, as always, enigmatic and hypnotizing, but she is an observer and lets the other characters do the talking; it takes highly skilled actors to command empathy for villains and the cast doesn't disappoint. Alexander Skarsgard is incredibly charismatic and persuasive, and he fills in the blanks admirably whenever his development is cut short. Patricia Clarkson surprises in an unusual role for her - she hints that her character might be more evil than any of the terrorists she is hunting. Jason Ritter and Hillary Baack are affecting in their small roles, and Julia Ormond dominates her five minutes of screen time - her last scene is perhaps the most haunting in the film. Ellen Page gives a career-best performances and reminds us that she's a force to be reckoned with if only she were given the chance to show off more often. She commands the screen with intimidating animosity from the second she walks on screen and has some genuinely heartbreaking moments later on. 

In spite of occasional misfires, the screenplay is exceptional especially in its efficiency: there is so much going on that there isn't much time to devote to individual characters or relationships - Marling and Ritter's suffers the most - but Marling and Batmanglij make every second count as each line is weighted with enough subtext to tell us the stories implicitly and thoroughly nevertheless. The major characters are very well-drawn; even though we only get glimpses into Skarsgard, Page and Kebbell's pasts, we feel we know them inside and out. The film moves along at a fluid, adrenaline-pumping pace and the tension is genuine and organic rather than forced - the audience's investment in the story grows from affection for the characters and connection with their ideals rather than cheap editing tricks, manipulative music and stylized lighting or sound. Music is used so sparsely that when The National's "About Today" plays over a silent montage of Marling's character breaking down, its emotional weight surprises and stuns. The ending is comparatively underwhelming, but the overall package is one of the best, most provocative thrillers in years and firmly establishes Batmanglij and Marling as a sensational and important pairing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,nude swimming,male nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002907/","name":"Alexander Skarsgård"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680983/","name":"Elliot Page"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

The film moves along at a fluid, adrenaline-pumping pace and the tension is genuine and organic rather than forced - the audience's investment in the story grows from affection for the characters and connection with their ideals rather than cheap editing tricks, manipulative music and stylized lighting or sound. Music is used so sparsely that when The National's "About Today" plays over a silent montage of Marling's character breaking down, its emotional weight surprises and stuns. The ending is comparatively underwhelming, but the overall package is one of the best, most provocative thrillers in years and firmly establishes Batmanglij and Marling as a sensational and important pairing.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,nude swimming,male nudity","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. programme.title: Parenthood
Spokojnie, tatuśku
Parenthood
programme.desc:
Parenthood: Directed by Ron Howard. With Steve Martin, Mary Steenburgen, Dianne Wiest, Jason Robards. The Buckmans are a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098067/","name":"Parenthood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3OTIwNzI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjgwNTcxMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Buckmans are a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098067/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chasman99"},"dateCreated":"2006-04-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Forever relevant","reviewBody":"I recall seeing this when it was released in '89. I found it funny but was only a Junior in high school at the time. Much of the humor and pain/struggle was lost on me. I rediscovered this on TV yesterday and just could not turn it off.

Having been married for a while and having kids of my own really brings this picture into focus. It is an amazing rendition of various families and how they are existing and treating their children. I identified so completely with Steve Martin's character that is was a bit scary.

I can see this film lasting the test of time very well. You can watch it as an outsider and enjoy the chaos or find yourself in one of the characters and enjoy the irony. Another Ron Howard masterpiece.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47736,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1989-08-02","keywords":"vomiting,dysfunctional family,cake,horse riding,happiness","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Parenthood","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi126786329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQ0MTY1MmUtMjZhZS00OWEzLTg3N2EtMGYzZjhhMDEwYWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQ0MTY1MmUtMjZhZS00OWEzLTg3N2EtMGYzZjhhMDEwYWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Parenthood"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000188/","name":"Steve Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005460/","name":"Mary Steenburgen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001848/","name":"Dianne Wiest"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0304665/","name":"Lowell Ganz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0541632/","name":"Babaloo Mandel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ma famille et le loup
Chłopiec i wilk
Ma famille et le loup
programme.desc:
Ma famille et le loup: Directed by Adrià García. With Carmen Maura, Pierre Rochefort, Bruno Salomone, Franc Bruneau. 9 years old Hugo spends the summer holidays with his cousins and his grandma Sara. When they learn that the wolf is coming to pick her up, the children are mobilizing to save their grandmother and embark on an unforgettable adventure." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5869404/","name":"Ma famille et le loup","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYwNmVlNTctM2MxYS00MWUyLTg0ZTYtYTg2NDIzMWU0YmNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjA1MDczNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"9 years old Hugo spends the summer holidays with his cousins and his grandma Sara. When they learn that the wolf is coming to pick her up, the children are mobilizing to save their grandmother and embark on an unforgettable adventure","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5869404/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"The wolf always wins.","reviewBody":"In the children's imaginative world there are the goodies (Santa Claus, the Tooth Fairy) and the baddies ( the Wolf ,the Bogey Man) .The Wolf wins in Charles Perrault' s "the Little Red riding Hood" ,even though the tale was often sweetened when told to children (the hunter's intervention).

Grandma met the Wolf when she was young (a little red riding hood ), but she was saved by the man who would become her husband (the equivalent of the hunter).But this summer ,he comes to take her back,now that she is about to celebrate her eightieth birthday.

Her grandchilden are not prepared to accept it ; instead of bickering ,they will spend their holidays looking for a way to prevent grandma from being "wolfed" .But the old lady had already told Hugo -it was the first time he had met her ,for his dad is a workaholic,often on his mobile - there was no sense in trying for she made a deal when she was young,and now her time has come.In the show they stage , granny appears in the finale -after some ponderous acts- just to say goodbye to all her family to urge them to carry on:we survive through our children and our life is eternal.

The movie adds computer animation for the imaginary scenes; the last ones ,in which the wolf intervenes with real characters,a la "Mary Poppins" , are the most successful.

By and large, nevertheless, acting and directing are not equal to the subject :with the exception of the deeply moving Carmen Maura , the actors overplay : the male cast ,particularly , tries to hog the stage and they are almost unbearable ;besides ,in the bakery , they got an incredible nerve ,not exactly an useful example for the young audience ;poetry which was present in Jean-Claude Brialy 's "Eglantine" (1971) on a similar subject is nowhere to be found.

That said, even though the results are not always satisfying , it was a good way to deal with a harsh subject :the ineluctable .The younger audience will certainly need explanations from their parents after viewing it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":88,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2019-08-21","keywords":"children","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2453519385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2ZiZWJhZTAtNThjMS00NWRhLWEzNDMtNDFkYTJlNDdjZWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2ZiZWJhZTAtNThjMS00NWRhLWEzNDMtNDFkYTJlNDdjZWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0560962/","name":"Carmen Maura"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734004/","name":"Pierre Rochefort"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0758912/","name":"Bruno Salomone"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2348224/","name":"Adrià García"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0596308/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0698042/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0384091/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5526293/","name":"Valérie Magis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1166131/","name":"Stéphane Malandrin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159646/","name":"Víctor Maldonado"}],"duration":"PT1H20M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Abyss
Otchłań
The Abyss
programme.desc:
The Abyss: Directed by James Cameron. With Ed Harris, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Michael Biehn, Leo Burmester. A civilian diving team is enlisted to search for a lost nuclear submarine and faces danger while encountering an alien aquatic species." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0096754/","name":"The Abyss","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWMzMDNlMDQtMTYyYi00OTM3LTllZDYtYThhMTk5MzNhZTRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDUyOTUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A civilian diving team is enlisted to search for a lost nuclear submarine and faces danger while encountering an alien aquatic species.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0096754/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"philip_vanderveken"},"dateCreated":"2005-04-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Breathtakingly beautiful","reviewBody":"When we think about aliens in the movies, I guess everybody immediately thinks about the series of "Alien" - movies, but there are some other fine examples and "The Abyss" may well be the best alternative I can come up with. Even though this was made by James Cameron, the same director who gave us "Aliens", both movies are very hard to compare.

When an American nuclear submarine is attacked during the cold war and crashes, the navy is convinced that it was the work of the Russians. They want to salvage the wreckage as soon as possible, because a storm is coming, but they aren't able to send a diving crew of their own that quickly. That's why they contact a group of workers of a nearby underwater oil rig, who reluctantly accept the job. They are joined by some navy SEALS who will help them to locate and investigate the cause of the crash. But they do not only find the crashed sub, they also find out that there is more down there in the deep than what they had ever expected to see.

What I liked so much about this movie was that this time the aliens didn't feel threatening at all. It was something completely different from what we were used to see and it worked perfectly. This was a beautiful, well-crafted movie with some very fine acting and with some excellent special effects. Even though this movie was created in 1989, the computer animations were still marvelous and breathtaking. In fact, this entire movie is breathtaking. It is very touching and powerful at the same time and I'm sure that many people will have a lot of difficulties not to show any emotions while watching it. I give this movie an 8/10. It sure doesn't deserve any less.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":171499,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1989-08-09","keywords":"submarine,trapped underwater,pantyhose,ocean,drowning","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Abyss","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2643788057","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYThkYjlhNGItN2Q1MC00Yjk5LWIwNzEtYWZiYjkxZDU1ZTFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYThkYjlhNGItN2Q1MC00Yjk5LWIwNzEtYWZiYjkxZDU1ZTFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000438/","name":"Ed Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001512/","name":"Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000299/","name":"Michael Biehn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000116/","name":"James Cameron"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0092551/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000116/","name":"James Cameron"}],"duration":"PT2H20M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: The Catcher Was a Spy
Projekt Larson
The Catcher Was a Spy
programme.desc:
The Catcher Was a Spy: Directed by Ben Lewin. With Paul Rudd, Pierfrancesco Favino, Tom Wilkinson, Connie Nielsen. Former Major League Baseball player Moe Berg goes undercover in World War II Europe for the Office of Strategic Services." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4602066/","name":"The Catcher Was a Spy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODhlNDc0ZTQtN2FiOS00OGRiLWE2YmYtZmI2ZmU1NzM5MmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Former Major League Baseball player Moe Berg goes undercover in World War II Europe for the Office of Strategic Services.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4602066/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"organicsocial"},"dateCreated":"2018-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Difference Between Spy Flicks and Spy Biopics","reviewBody":"What comes to mind when we talk about a spy films? Something like Mission Impossible, James Bond or a little different ones like Salt, Red Sparrow and so on... ?

Well there is a basic difference between spy fiction and the reality of spy trade-craft. Although the most exciting of the spy thrillers try to capture some of the elements of real world spying but those are mostly technical aspects which are adopted to give these movies a certain credibility; to make them believable to some extent. 

Spy biopics like 'The Catcher Was a Spy' are different from these spy action thrillers because the titular characters are not out there to perform stunts. They are out there to gather real and sensitive information. Information which could decide the fate of a real war and a real man's life. The thrill in this movie comes from the grand scope of the mission and the conversely understated actions of a spy so as to avoid all attention. There are no guns blazing here. 

This is Paul Rudd's classic regular guy performances at it's best. The real life Moe Berg was an anomaly. A sportsman with unexceptional career but a genius mind of sorts. Quite simply a good candidate for a spy in second world war but not of much use afterwards. 

If you are watching this movie for the spy thrills then you might be disappointed. However, if you want to get a glimpse of what an American spy must have found out after talking to people like Werner Heisenberg about the nuclear weapons program of Nazi Germany, then it might be worth it.

I can compare 'The Catcher was a Spy' to a bit more contemporary spy biopic like 'Snowden'. Although completely different in tone and nature, both these spy biopics have something in common. They are about getting to know the mind of the person. Both these movies try to bring out the inner complexities of these people who are quite literally doing a job that demands them to be secretive, deceptive and yet charming.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9019,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2018-06-22","keywords":"espionage,spy,baseball,baseball player,boston red sox","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2587998233","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5N2JmYmMtNzQzNy00N2E5LWJhZjktMDQ5YmFmYjI4ZDE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5N2JmYmMtNzQzNy00N2E5LWJhZjktMDQ5YmFmYjI4ZDE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Catcher Was a Spy tells the true story of Morris "Moe" Berg (Paul Rudd), the Major League Baseball player, Ivy League graduate, attorney and top-secret spy who helped the U.S. defeat Nazi Germany in the race to build the atomic bomb."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0748620/","name":"Paul Rudd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269419/","name":"Pierfrancesco Favino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506802/","name":"Ben Lewin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037203/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0092860/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240363/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734441/","name":"Robert Rodat"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7260546/","name":"Nicholas Dawidoff"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

Something like Mission Impossible, James Bond or a little different ones like Salt, Red Sparrow and so on... ?

Well there is a basic difference between spy fiction and the reality of spy trade-craft. Although the most exciting of the spy thrillers try to capture some of the elements of real world spying but those are mostly technical aspects which are adopted to give these movies a certain credibility; to make them believable to some extent. 

Spy biopics like 'The Catcher Was a Spy' are different from these spy action thrillers because the titular characters are not out there to perform stunts. They are out there to gather real and sensitive information. Information which could decide the fate of a real war and a real man's life. The thrill in this movie comes from the grand scope of the mission and the conversely understated actions of a spy so as to avoid all attention. There are no guns blazing here. 

This is Paul Rudd's classic regular guy performances at it's best. The real life Moe Berg was an anomaly. A sportsman with unexceptional career but a genius mind of sorts. Quite simply a good candidate for a spy in second world war but not of much use afterwards. 

If you are watching this movie for the spy thrills then you might be disappointed. However, if you want to get a glimpse of what an American spy must have found out after talking to people like Werner Heisenberg about the nuclear weapons program of Nazi Germany, then it might be worth it.

I can compare 'The Catcher was a Spy' to a bit more contemporary spy biopic like 'Snowden'. Although completely different in tone and nature, both these spy biopics have something in common. They are about getting to know the mind of the person. Both these movies try to bring out the inner complexities of these people who are quite literally doing a job that demands them to be secretive, deceptive and yet charming.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9019,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2018-06-22","keywords":"espionage,spy,baseball,baseball player,boston red sox","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2587998233","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5N2JmYmMtNzQzNy00N2E5LWJhZjktMDQ5YmFmYjI4ZDE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5N2JmYmMtNzQzNy00N2E5LWJhZjktMDQ5YmFmYjI4ZDE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Catcher Was a Spy tells the true story of Morris "Moe" Berg (Paul Rudd), the Major League Baseball player, Ivy League graduate, attorney and top-secret spy who helped the U.S. defeat Nazi Germany in the race to build the atomic bomb.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0748620/","name":"Paul Rudd","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269419/","name":"Pierfrancesco Favino","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506802/","name":"Ben Lewin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037203/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0092860/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240363/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734441/","name":"Robert Rodat","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7260546/","name":"Nicholas Dawidoff"],"duration":"PT1H34M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
L'uomo del labirinto: Directed by Donato Carrisi. With Dustin Hoffman, Toni Servillo, Valentina Bellè, Vinicio Marchioni. Samantha, a young girl who was kidnapped, resurfaces in shock after being imprisoned and hospitalized." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8594376/","name":"L'uomo del labirinto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzkyNGIwYjEtNDhjYi00YjY4LWIwNTYtYjRkYzcyNWEyZWY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTg1MzYyMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Samantha, a young girl who was kidnapped, resurfaces in shock after being imprisoned and hospitalized.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8594376/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ebeckstr-1"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A fun ride which ultimately makes no sense","reviewBody":"This movie is a bit underrated at 5.6 stars at this moment. The acting is very good from top to bottom. As others have noted it's also an entertaining callback to 70s Italian giallo cinema, both in terms of the lurid, convoluted plot and the self-consciously stylized, artistic visual design.

Similar to some of those classic '70s flicks, at the end of the day the plot within a plot, story within a story of this movie doesn't make complete sense. If you examine it with cold-hearted logic logic you'd have to apply some significant contortions to fill the plot holes and get it to all work out. But also at the end of the day I'm not sure this lack of complete internal logic can really be seen as a flaw since it is a pretty traditional, even defining, feature of this kind of movie.

Bottom line, this is an entertaining movie filled with good acting, a beautiful to look at visual style, consistent suspense, and a pervasive sense of mystery.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3049,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"genre":["Crime","Drama","Horror"],"datePublished":"2019-10-30","keywords":"rabbit,written by director,kidnapping,kidnapped,profiler","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2444803865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTNlMmExYjItNGIxNS00NGVkLTk0NDctZTZjZDU0N2IxMzcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWdhbWF6b2E@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTNlMmExYjItNGIxNS00NGVkLTk0NDctZTZjZDU0N2IxMzcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWdhbWF6b2E@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000163/","name":"Dustin Hoffman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0785842/","name":"Toni Servillo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6188249/","name":"Valentina Bellè"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2621810/","name":"Donato Carrisi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0744965/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0657655/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2621810/","name":"Donato Carrisi"}],"duration":"PT2H10M"}</script><metacontent="

A reimagining of Hamlet, told from Ophelia's perspective." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5690810/","name":"Ophelia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2OTAxNjI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzc2NjUwODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A reimagining of Hamlet, told from Ophelia's perspective.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5690810/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tgraykgray"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cannot always trust critics.","reviewBody":"Possibly because Hamlet is my favourite Shakespeare play, this film held me totally. Almost put off by other people's opinions,thank fully decided for myself. This was very clever,and holding. No two share fully the same views,but I am glad that to mine own self I was true. A haunting film,and I will never watch Hamlet in the same way again. Funny that it was so well received in Russia. programme.title: Miasta rytm: Zrabowane dzieła sztuki
programme.desc: W trakcie II wojny światowej z Polski zniknęły setki tysięcy bezcennych dzieł sztuki. Zarówno niemieccy, jak i radzieccy okupanci masowo wywozili obrazy i rzeźby. Nie wszystkie udało się odzyskać. Obecnie wiele z tych polskich zbiorów rozsianych jest po całym świecie. Historyk sztuki Jerzy S. Majewski przybliża losy tych zrabowanych dóbr. Snuje opowieść o skradzionym dorobku wielu wspaniałych artystów i wyjaśnia, co się z nim dokładnie stało.

programme.title: Aktualności filmowe+
programme.desc: W cotygodniowym programie zostają przedstawione najbardziej interesujące wydarzenia ze świata kina. Pojawiają się wywiady z osobami związanymi z branżą filmową, prowadzone są rozmowy na temat premier, nowości muzycznych i teatralnych.

programme.title: The Salisbury Poisonings
The Salisbury Poisonings
Truciciele z Salisbury
The Salisbury Poisonings
programme.desc:
The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Annabel Scholey, Judah Cousin. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"neilleacy"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"An insight into what want on behind the headlines.","reviewBody":"I know from local newspaper articles that many people in Salisbury felt that the showing of this docu-drama was too soon after the event. That it would rake over old coals and put our city once again in a bad light. We'll for me it didn't.

For those looking for a hard-hitting insight into how and why the Russians attempted what they did or why the suspects have never been charged then go watch the news specials that came out at the time. But for a view of how the real people at the heart of this whole affair were really affected then the writers, directors and actors have done a good job.

Yes, it is low key in its look and feel. Yes, there are a lot of people who know Salisbury thinking 'that's not somewhere I recognise'; the use of locations from other cathedral cities threw me off the narrative a couple of times wondering where the characters were meant to be. But most importantly it drew me in to understanding more of how just frightening the possible outcome of not having an early intervention could have been and the emotional strain on those key families.

For you 1 star reviewers I say your expectations were skewed from the start. It was good to see what felt like a truthful docu-drama.

And as my son said at the end of part 3, 'well, that was emotional.'","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4401,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2118257/","name":"Annabel Scholey"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. Within three days of the assassination attempt on double agent and spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, key agencies discovered that a lethal nerve agent called Novichok was used, just half a teaspoon of which could kill 20,000 people. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 10394886, Title: The Salisbury Poisonings, --- Description: The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Annabel Scholey, Judah Cousin. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"neilleacy","dateCreated":"2020-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"An insight into what want on behind the headlines.","reviewBody":"I know from local newspaper articles that many people in Salisbury felt that the showing of this docu-drama was too soon after the event. That it would rake over old coals and put our city once again in a bad light. We'll for me it didn't.

For those looking for a hard-hitting insight into how and why the Russians attempted what they did or why the suspects have never been charged then go watch the news specials that came out at the time. But for a view of how the real people at the heart of this whole affair were really affected then the writers, directors and actors have done a good job.

Yes, it is low key in its look and feel. Yes, there are a lot of people who know Salisbury thinking 'that's not somewhere I recognise'; the use of locations from other cathedral cities threw me off the narrative a couple of times wondering where the characters were meant to be. But most importantly it drew me in to understanding more of how just frightening the possible outcome of not having an early intervention could have been and the emotional strain on those key families.

For you 1 star reviewers I say your expectations were skewed from the start. It was good to see what felt like a truthful docu-drama.

And as my son said at the end of part 3, 'well, that was emotional.'","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4401,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2118257/","name":"Annabel Scholey"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. Within three days of the assassination attempt on double agent and spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, key agencies discovered that a lethal nerve agent called Novichok was used, just half a teaspoon of which could kill 20,000 people. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."</script><metacontent="

A teenager living with her working-class family on a council estate in Wolverhampton, England, grows up to become a popular but conflicted music journalist." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4193072/","name":"How to Build a Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGUyN2ZlMjYtZTk2Yy00MWZiLWIyMDktMzFlMmEzOWVlMGNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTE1MzI2NzIz._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager living with her working-class family on a council estate in Wolverhampton, England, grows up to become a popular but conflicted music journalist.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4193072/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gracesiobhan"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why can no one do a Midlands accent?","reviewBody":"I love Beanie. But why, in many films and TV shows that are set in and around the Black Country area, do they not cast actors from the same area, or who can at least do the accent? Paddy's accent was OK. programme.title: Acid Rain
programme.desc: Młoda ucieka z domu. Podróżuje autostopem. Poznaje niezrównoważonego dziwaka Chudego. Pod osłoną nocy snują się po mieście, docierają w coraz dziwniejsze rejony, doświadczając niezwykłych emocji.

programme.title: ABC gotowania
programme.desc: Prowadząca program Marieta Marecka udziela praktycznych porad wszystkim amatorom gotowania.

programme.title: Wyzwanie - nowe mieszkanie 11
programme.desc: Damian Urbańczyk wprowadza widzów w tajniki rynku nieruchomości i radzi, na co zwrócić uwagę kupując mieszkanie. Prowadzący wyjaśni m.in. zjawisko o nazwie house flipping. To sposób inwestowania, który wymaga wolnych zasobów gotówki i wiedzy w zakresie budownictwa. Polega na tym, by znaleźć lokal w niskiej cenie i po przeprowadzeniu remontu sprzedać go z zyskiem.

programme.title: Czy na pewno umiesz gotować?
programme.desc: Mistrzowie domowej kuchni poznają prawdę o swoim kulinarnym talencie. Bohaterem każdego odcinka jest osoba zgłoszona przez rodzinę. Każdy myśli, że został wybrany ze względu na swoje zdolności. Tymczasem okazuje się, że bliscy mają już dość przesolonej lasagne, mdłej pomidorówki lub twardych schabowych, ale boją się powiedzieć to wprost kucharzowi amatorowi. Znany szef kuchni Andrzej Polan ocenia umiejętności swoich gości i pomaga im podszkolić się w trudnej sztuce gotowania.

credits.actor: Andrzej Polan

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

credits.actor: Karolina Kuszewska-Łukasik, Sasha Sidorenko, Sylwia Zaczkiewicz, Dominika Rembelska, Gabriela Kuzawińska, Ewa Piątkowska, Joanna Jędrzejczyk, Sylwia Kusiak, Magdalena Loska

programme.title: THE LEGENDS z Tomkiem Ćwiąkałą
programme.desc: Cykl wywiadów przeprowadzanych przez Tomka Ćwiąkałę z ważnymi postaciami ze świata futbolu. Wśród nich są mistrzowie świata, Europy i gwiazdy topowych lig. Widzowie dowiedzą się, czym zajmują się dzisiaj, jak wspominają swoje kariery oraz poznają ich plany na przyszłość.

credits.actor: Maciej Orłowski
Maciej Orłowski
Maciej Orłowski
Maciej Orłowski

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek 4
programme.desc: Gospodyni programu, znana blogerka Marta Dymek, postara się zarazić widzów swoją miłością do wegańskiej kuchni i przekonać ich, że dania z przepisów opartych wyłącznie na roślinach są równie pyszne, co te tradycyjne. W każdym odcinku przedstawi trzy oryginalne potrawy.

programme.title: Jakubiak lokalnie 3
programme.desc: Tomasz Jakubiak po raz trzeci wyrusza w Polskę, aby odkrywać lokalne smaki i aromaty. Odwiedza różne miejsca i czerpie inspiracje z różnych produktów. Łączy nieznane tradycyjne smaki z kucharską maestrią. Tym razem prowadzący przypomina widzom o istnieniu krajowych serów pleśniowych, tradycyjnych jogurtów oraz doskonałych ziół, rewelacyjnych miodów pitnych a także potraw, które od stuleci przygotowują, mieszkające w naszym kraju mniejszości narodowe.

programme.title: Remont w 48h
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski odwiedza ludzi, którzy chcieliby zrobić w swoim mieszkaniu remont, ale boją się kosztów i utrudnień. Architekt udowodni im, że metamorfozę można przeprowadzić szybko, tanio i bezproblemowo.

credits.actor: Maciej Orłowski
Maciej Orłowski

programme.title: Na cenzurowanym
Master of the Classe
programme.desc: Berry (Sébastien Chassagne) ma 35 lat i dopiero niedawno dostał pracę jako stażysta w gimnazjum. Jego marzenie o stabilnym zatrudnieniu zostaje poddane próbie. Pewnego dnia ma się odbyć inspekcja jego lekcji, której wynik zadecyduje o tym, czy mężczyzna zdobędzie stałą posadę.

programme.title: W spirali
W spirali
programme.desc: W spirali: Directed by Konrad Aksinowicz. With Piotr Stramowski, Katarzyna Warnke, Olga Boladz, Antoni Królikowski. An out of town car trip, which was meant to have a purifying effect on the trouble-stricken married couple, turns into a dangerous interaction between characters when they pick up an eccentric traveler, Tamir. Tamir is a witness to, and a catalyst of their problems, a self-appointed healer wishing to become their path to enlightenment. Krzysztof and Agnes know they shouldn't be together but they are unable to part, or perhaps they do not want to? "Into the Spiral" is a story of love which is restless, dangerous and toxic." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4092514/","name":"W spirali","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWY3M2NjNWMtNzY3MC00NGY3LWJiNTMtMWEyZTBmZjc4OGJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY0OTk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An out of town car trip, which was meant to have a purifying effect on the trouble-stricken married couple, turns into a dangerous interaction between characters when they pick up an eccentric traveler, Tamir.
