In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2935476/","name":"Far from the Madding Crowd","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzI4NzUwNDgwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTI3MjMwNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2935476/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"KateC49","dateCreated":"2015-07-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Exquisitley filmed but lacks the energy of the first (1967) film","reviewBody":"This has always been one of my favourite books & films and I was keen to see what they did with this a second time around. But what I want to say after seeing it was 1/see the first film 2/read the book. One of the most essential points to film was left out altogether in that when Bathsheba sent her 'joke' valentine to Boldwood she wrote the words 'Marry Me' on it. It wasn't the roses-are-red etc that got Boldwood in a twist it was the two words she wrote on the card. We get no sense of the quandary and deliberating over this that went on within Boldwood for some time before he made his move (and his ultimate obsession) in this film as we do in the first.

I think the scene when Fanny got the wrong church was disappointing as well. There was no sense of the mad dash she had across town to find the right church and only to find Frank striding out full of indignation at being stood up and telling her "It's too late!" The beautiful words of Gabriel to Bathsheba "when I look up there ye will be and when you look up there I will be" just don't feature at all.

The "shooting at the end was tame to say the least & Martin Sheen was much less forceful in his insistence of marrying Bathsheba But I did like Carey Mulligan as Bathdheba. What was missing was the energy & drama the original film had and dare I say it some Wessex accents....","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47755,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2015-05-01","keywords":"farm,sheep,three men in love with the same woman,based on novel,playing","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2575019545","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyNTMzMjA4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzMyNzE1NDE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyNTMzMjA4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzMyNzE1NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor.

programme.title: Never Say Never Again
Nigdy nie mów nigdy
Never Say Never Again
programme.desc:
Never Say Never Again: Directed by Irvin Kershner. With Sean Connery, Klaus Maria Brandauer, Max von Sydow, Barbara Carrera. A S.P.E.C.T.R.E. Agent has stolen two American nuclear warheads, and James Bond must find their targets before they are detonated." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0086006/","name":"Never Say Never Again","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1NjgzMDkwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM4NzI0NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A S.P.E.C.T.R.E. Agent has stolen two American nuclear warheads, and James Bond must find their targets before they are detonated.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0086006/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"OllieSuave-007"},"dateCreated":"2017-06-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's more like a stand-alone action flick.","reviewBody":"Sean Connery returns as James Bond, in a movie remake of Thunderball. Here, mad man Maximilian Largo steals two American nuclear warheads and demands millions of dollars in ransom from the world leaders. As a result, MI6 reactivates their "00" agents and James Bond comes out of retirement to carry on the mission.

Armed with secret weapons and an armor of one-liners, Connery still shines once again as the suave 007, though, he does look rather emotionless and mellow portraying his character at times. There is lesser action in this movie than in previous Bond films, but some of the the thrills are still a little entertaining, especially the part where Bond attempts to dispatch the femme fatale Fatima Blush (Barbara Carrera).

Sorely missing is John Berry's iconic James Bond theme and score, and what we have instead is a very 80s-sounding soundtrack from Michel Legrand. The acting was just OK for the most part - Connery had some good chemistry with the Bond Girls, but much of the other cast members were forgettable. Max von Sydow gave a mediocre performance as Blofeld, Edward Fox gave a very overzealous and pompous portrayal of M and Rowan Atkinson gave a rather unfunny role as Small-Fawcett. Klaus Maria Brandauer gave a convincing villain in Maximilian Largo - slimy and sly, making you want to punch him in the face.

The film its adventurous moments, but, it's not one of the best Bond movies out there - it's more like a stand alone action flick.

Grade C+","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":65450,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1983-10-07","keywords":"unofficial sequel,james bond character,tough girl,gun violence,spy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Never Say Never Again","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1906574617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzYyYzlhNDktYTM1OS00YzI3LWIxZDUtYTA2MTA1NzI5NzdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzYyYzlhNDktYTM1OS00YzI3LWIxZDUtYTA2MTA1NzI5NzdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from MGM/UA"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000125/","name":"Sean Connery"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000107/","name":"Kim Basinger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001970/","name":"Klaus Maria Brandauer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0449984/","name":"Irvin Kershner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033675/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078552/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035468/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0565886/","name":"Kevin McClory"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926525/","name":"Jack Whittingham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"}],"duration":"PT2H14M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Winter's Bone
Do szpiku kości
Winter's Bone
programme.desc:
Winter's Bone: Directed by Debra Granik. With Jennifer Lawrence, Isaiah Stone, Ashlee Thompson, Valerie Richards. An unflinching Ozark Mountain girl hacks through dangerous social terrain as she hunts down her drug-dealing father while trying to keep her family intact." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1399683/","name":"Winter's Bone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0OTM3MDMxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDY1MjI0Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unflinching Ozark Mountain girl hacks through dangerous social terrain as she hunts down her drug-dealing father while trying to keep her family intact.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1399683/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Bob-45"},"dateCreated":"2013-01-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Outstanding, if you like ultra-realism","reviewBody":"While I have seen many more entertaining film and certainly more profound, I cannot remember the last time I saw a film so realistic I felt I was there.

The very realism of "Winter's Bone" undercuts its pacing and dramatic impact. The film opens slowly and my wife nearly lost interest before the story engrossed her. Perhaps given my "country cousin" roots, I was immediately taken in. As a writer I was astounded at how many times I could not predict what would happen next. Yet, every scene flows naturally into the next.

While I found some of the dialog unintelligible, the "natural sound" so accentuated the film's atmosphere I didn't care. Certainly, I had no trouble understanding all the necessary interchanges.

While all performances are "pitch perfect," Jennifer Lawrence and John Hawkes certainly deserved their Oscar nominations and numerous awards. Likewise, writer/director deserved her Oscar nomination for writing. She should have received one for directing. In any event, she is one to watch and, in my opinion, a much better director than Oscar winner Kathryn Bigelow.

There are no really "big" messages here. Nonetheless the "small" messages of humanity,community and personal honor shine like a beacon. I give "Winter's Bone" a "10"."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":139844,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-07-16","keywords":"ozark mountains,family relationships,drug trade,family crisis,search for father","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Winter's Bone","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3239184153","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0MTg3OTQzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjMxMTczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0MTg3OTQzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjMxMTczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"17 year-old Ree Dolly (Jennifer Lawrence) sets out to track down her father, who put their house up for his bail bond and then disappeared. If she fails, Ree and her family will be turned out into the Ozark woods. Challenging her outlaw kinÂ’s code of silence and risking her life, Ree hacks through the lies, evasions and threats offered up by her relatives and begins to piece together the truth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2225369/","name":"Jennifer Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370035/","name":"John Hawkes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0226813/","name":"Garret Dillahunt"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0335138/","name":"Debra Granik"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017525/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0271803/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0335138/","name":"Debra Granik"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1367893/","name":"Anne Rosellini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0940410/","name":"Daniel Woodrell"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Long Day's Dying
Kres długiego dnia
The Long Day's Dying
programme.desc: The Long Day's Dying: Directed by Peter Collinson. With David Hemmings, Tony Beckley, Tom Bell, Alan Dobie. The saga of three British soldiers and their German captive as they trek through the European countryside." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0063237/","name":"The Long Day's Dying","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWEyMzM4ZGUtMmI2NC00OTA5LTljNjQtMzNiODQwM2E2ZTcwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4MjA5MzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The saga of three British soldiers and their German captive as they trek through the European countryside.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0063237/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"david-karl-szkrobot"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Forgotten Film?","reviewBody":"I saw the long day's dying when it first came out at the cinema, I thought the film gave a good soldiers point of view, it gave a realistic account, of men at war. The storyline moves at a nice pace, showing a group of men behind enemy lines, and trying to return back to their own lines with an enemy prisoner. The characters are well developed, and believable.\n\nDavid Hemmings is a good actor and plays the leading role with conviction, as does Alan Dobie (as German Helmut) I was surprised, that i have been unable to find this film on VHS or DVD, and I feel it has become the forgotten film, which is sad , as it is superior to many other war films I have seen.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":477,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1968-05-28","keywords":"shot to death,no survivors,farmhouse,corpse,cult film","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0376101/","name":"David Hemmings"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065777/","name":"Tony Beckley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0068552/","name":"Tom Bell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0172772/","name":"Peter Collinson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010407/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0924430/","name":"Alan White"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0939606/","name":"Charles Wood"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

La Nave del Olvido
programme.desc: La Nave del Olvido: Directed by Nicol Ruiz Benavides. With Rosa Ramírez, Romana Satt, Gabriela Arancibia, Cristóbal Ruiz. Claudina is a traditional woman from the countryside. After the pass away of her husband, she gets into a lonely routine. Having a difficult economic situation, Claudina has to move with her dearest grandson Cristóbal, and her daughter Alejandra, knowing that both women have a distanced relationship. Living together, Claudina meets the neighbor Elsa, an independent and married woman who sings on a hidden bar called "Porvenir" (The Future.) Claudina starts a relationship with Elsa, getting in love. Since then, she develops a journey of self-knowledge to be free, under the judgment of her daughter and friends on a religious and conservatory little town, obsessed with UFO sighting." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12888166/","name":"La Nave del Olvido","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThkMDJjNzktMGJmNy00OWMyLWI3ZjktNjczZTAzNTk1YTE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMzODQ4NzQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Claudina is a traditional woman from the countryside. programme.title: Valkyrie
Walkiria
Valkyrie
programme.desc:
Valkyrie: Directed by Bryan Singer. With Tom Cruise, Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson. A dramatization of the July 20, 1944 assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Adolf Hitler during World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0985699/","name":"Valkyrie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3Njc2ODEyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTAwMzc3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dramatization of the July 20, 1944 assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Adolf Hitler during World War II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0985699/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fwomp"},"dateCreated":"2010-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Critics Were Wrong...","reviewBody":""Not only is Singer's film-making aesthetically frustrating (lacking coherent visual rhythm) but his juvenile regard of the July 20, 1944, plot to kill Hitler -- one of 15 documented attempts -- is intellectually insulting..." New York Press The above is the usual negative commentary you'll see regarding this film. Critics bashed it for being insulting, unoriginal, and unmoving. Let me make some corrections for them so that they can save a little face.

I'm no Tom Cruise fan. A buddy of mine, too, is so peeved at Cruise that he refuses to watch anything the man stars in. Mostly this has to do with Cruise's personal life and beliefs (just watch an episode of South Park to see how some people view him and you'll see what I mean). People have similar feelings toward Mel Gibson ...but I digress.

VALKYRIE, as most of you probably now know, is the final of 15 attempts on Hitler's life. Shortly after this (about nine months) he committed suicide in his bunker. But this is about the one time where it almost succeeded. I'd heard about this attempt and read bits of it in history classes, but never really gave it much thought. I mean, the mustachioed murderer offed himself, so that was that. But what gives this film much of its umpf! is how true to history the story sticks (that and how closely many of the actors resemble their true-life counterparts). It is also riveting coming from director Bryan Singer (who did one of my all-time favorite films, THE USUAL SUSPECTS).

Tom Cruise did a great job (probably one of his best since COLLATERAL and MINORITY REPORT). His Colonel Claus von Stauffenberg character was spot-on ...with one exception that seems to be a sticking point for many: his accent. It is true that none of the actors attempts a German cadence in their speech. Did this bother me? No. I think it would have bothered me if they'd TRIED to do one and made it sound forced or ridiculous. So there's that...

What makes the film a success was Cruise's rock solid performance and the amazing supporting cast: Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson, Terrence Stamp, and Eddie Izzard just to sprinkle a few names.

It is also noteworthy to mention that they filmed nearly everything on-location and in the exact same spots where the original incidents took place, including the subsequent trials and executions of the conspirators. Phenomenal authenticity.

If the cadence of their speech bothered some, then I failed to see how the cadence of the film could. It was absolutely perfect. It gradually built up suspense (even though we knew how it would end for the conspirators), and never slowed, right up until the very end. I am forced to use a cliché here in that "I was on the edge of my seat" throughout the second half of the film.

So if you're looking to tear apart Tom Cruise, you might look at WAR OF THE WORLDS or LEGEND. But not here.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":235855,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2009-01-21","keywords":"national socialism,near miss,dilettantism,incompetence,20 july plot","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Valkyrie: Featurette -- "Through Bryan Singer's Eyes"","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3544383513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxODczMTg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODE0NTYyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxODczMTg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODE0NTYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Valkyrie: Featurette -- "Through Bryan Singer's Eyes""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000129/","name":"Tom Cruise"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631490/","name":"Bill Nighy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0396924/","name":"Carice van Houten"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001741/","name":"Bryan Singer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057712/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003160/","name":"Christopher McQuarrie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1267492/","name":"Nathan Alexander"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

A dramatization of the July 20, 1944 assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Adolf Hitler during World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0985699/","name":"Valkyrie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3Njc2ODEyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTAwMzc3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dramatization of the July 20, 1944 assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Adolf Hitler during World War II.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0985699/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"fwomp","dateCreated":"2010-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Critics Were Wrong...","reviewBody":""Not only is Singer's film-making aesthetically frustrating (lacking coherent visual rhythm) but his juvenile regard of the July 20, 1944, plot to kill Hitler -- one of 15 documented attempts -- is intellectually insulting..." New York Press The above is the usual negative commentary you'll see regarding this film. Critics bashed it for being insulting, unoriginal, and unmoving. Let me make some corrections for them so that they can save a little face.

I'm no Tom Cruise fan. A buddy of mine, too, is so peeved at Cruise that he refuses to watch anything the man stars in. Mostly this has to do with Cruise's personal life and beliefs (just watch an episode of South Park to see how some people view him and you'll see what I mean). People have similar feelings toward Mel Gibson ...but I digress.

VALKYRIE, as most of you probably now know, is the final of 15 attempts on Hitler's life. Shortly after this (about nine months) he committed suicide in his bunker. But this is about the one time where it almost succeeded. I'd heard about this attempt and read bits of it in history classes, but never really gave it much thought. I mean, the mustachioed murderer offed himself, so that was that. But what gives this film much of its umpf! is how true to history the story sticks (that and how closely many of the actors resemble their true-life counterparts). It is also riveting coming from director Bryan Singer (who did one of my all-time favorite films, THE USUAL SUSPECTS).

Tom Cruise did a great job (probably one of his best since COLLATERAL and MINORITY REPORT). His Colonel Claus von Stauffenberg character was spot-on ...with one exception that seems to be a sticking point for many: his accent. It is true that none of the actors attempts a German cadence in their speech. Did this bother me? No. I think it would have bothered me if they'd TRIED to do one and made it sound forced or ridiculous. So there's that...

What makes the film a success was Cruise's rock solid performance and the amazing supporting cast: Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson, Terrence Stamp, and Eddie Izzard just to sprinkle a few names.

It is also noteworthy to mention that they filmed nearly everything on-location and in the exact same spots where the original incidents took place, including the subsequent trials and executions of the conspirators. Phenomenal authenticity.

If the cadence of their speech bothered some, then I failed to see how the cadence of the film could. It was absolutely perfect. It gradually built up suspense (even though we knew how it would end for the conspirators), and never slowed, right up until the very end. I am forced to use a cliché here in that "I was on the edge of my seat" throughout the second half of the film.

So if you're looking to tear apart Tom Cruise, you might look at WAR OF THE WORLDS or LEGEND. But not here.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":235855,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2009-01-21","keywords":"national socialism,near miss,dilettantism,incompetence,20 july plot","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Valkyrie: Featurette -- "Through Bryan Singer's Eyes"","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3544383513","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxODczMTg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODE0NTYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxODczMTg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODE0NTYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Valkyrie: Featurette -- "Through Bryan Singer's Eyes"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000129/","name":"Tom Cruise","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631490/","name":"Bill Nighy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0396924/","name":"Carice van Houten"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001741/","name":"Bryan Singer"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057712/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003160/","name":"Christopher McQuarrie","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1267492/","name":"Nathan Alexander"],"duration":"PT2H1M"</script><metacontent="

Smoke
programme.desc:
Smoke: Directed by Wayne Wang. With Giancarlo Esposito, José Zúñiga, Stephen Gevedon, Harvey Keitel. A Brooklyn smoke shop is the center of neighborhood activity, and the stories of its customers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0114478/","name":"Smoke","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjUwYTdiYjItNTgzNS00MmQ3LWJlMDctODMyNTkxMjIxMDgwL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Brooklyn smoke shop is the center of neighborhood activity, and the stories of its customers.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0114478/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"agvii"},"dateCreated":"2003-03-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Beautiful Film","reviewBody":"Though the writing is very "stagey", the acting is fantastic all around. The more you allow yourself to get into this movie, the more you will enjoy it. The soundtrack insidiously lulls the viewer into a state where the everyday is made beautiful.

This movie is full of overlooked performances by some of today's best actors, including Forest Whitaker, Harold Perrineau Jr, (who most people know from the OZ HBO series), and Ashley Judd, whose takes one of the smallest roles in the movie but develops an extraordinary character.

Harvey Keitel and William Hurt have a dynamic in each scene that shows the true brilliance of each actor. Stockard Channing plays a character that could easily have been overacted with a style and realism that engage the viewer.

Certainly a movie you have to put yourself into, but you won't be disappointed if you do."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35407,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1995-06-09","keywords":"smoke,cigarette smoking,death of wife,year 1990,summer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Smoke","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2536243225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjE3MWZjN2EtMTRjMi00MjFiLWI5NWUtNjJmOTFlMGM0ZDJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjE3MWZjN2EtMTRjMi00MjFiLWI5NWUtNjJmOTFlMGM0ZDJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Miramax"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000172/","name":"Harvey Keitel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000458/","name":"William Hurt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002064/","name":"Giancarlo Esposito"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911061/","name":"Wayne Wang"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0055105/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070053/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000808/","name":"Paul Auster"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

A Brooklyn smoke shop is the center of neighborhood activity, and the stories of its customers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0114478/","name":"Smoke","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjUwYTdiYjItNTgzNS00MmQ3LWJlMDctODMyNTkxMjIxMDgwL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Brooklyn smoke shop is the center of neighborhood activity, and the stories of its customers.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0114478/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"agvii","dateCreated":"2003-03-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Beautiful Film","reviewBody":"Though the writing is very "stagey", the acting is fantastic all around. The more you allow yourself to get into this movie, the more you will enjoy it. The soundtrack insidiously lulls the viewer into a state where the everyday is made beautiful.

This movie is full of overlooked performances by some of today's best actors, including Forest Whitaker, Harold Perrineau Jr, (who most people know from the OZ HBO series), and Ashley Judd, whose takes one of the smallest roles in the movie but develops an extraordinary character.

Harvey Keitel and William Hurt have a dynamic in each scene that shows the true brilliance of each actor. Stockard Channing plays a character that could easily have been overacted with a style and realism that engage the viewer.

Certainly a movie you have to put yourself into, but you won't be disappointed if you do.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35407,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1995-06-09","keywords":"smoke,cigarette smoking,death of wife,year 1990,summer","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Smoke","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2536243225","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjE3MWZjN2EtMTRjMi00MjFiLWI5NWUtNjJmOTFlMGM0ZDJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjE3MWZjN2EtMTRjMi00MjFiLWI5NWUtNjJmOTFlMGM0ZDJmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Miramax","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000172/","name":"Harvey Keitel","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000458/","name":"William Hurt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002064/","name":"Giancarlo Esposito"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911061/","name":"Wayne Wang"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0055105/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070053/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000808/","name":"Paul Auster"],"duration":"PT1H52M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Valkyrie
Walkiria
Valkyrie
programme.desc:
Valkyrie: Directed by Bryan Singer. With Tom Cruise, Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson. A dramatization of the July 20, 1944 assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Adolf Hitler during World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0985699/","name":"Valkyrie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3Njc2ODEyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTAwMzc3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dramatization of the July 20, 1944 assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Adolf Hitler during World War II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0985699/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fwomp"},"dateCreated":"2010-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Critics Were Wrong...","reviewBody":""Not only is Singer's film-making aesthetically frustrating (lacking coherent visual rhythm) but his juvenile regard of the July 20, 1944, plot to kill Hitler -- one of 15 documented attempts -- is intellectually insulting..." New York Press The above is the usual negative commentary you'll see regarding this film. Critics bashed it for being insulting, unoriginal, and unmoving. Let me make some corrections for them so that they can save a little face.

I'm no Tom Cruise fan. A buddy of mine, too, is so peeved at Cruise that he refuses to watch anything the man stars in. Mostly this has to do with Cruise's personal life and beliefs (just watch an episode of South Park to see how some people view him and you'll see what I mean). People have similar feelings toward Mel Gibson ...but I digress.

VALKYRIE, as most of you probably now know, is the final of 15 attempts on Hitler's life. Shortly after this (about nine months) he committed suicide in his bunker. But this is about the one time where it almost succeeded. I'd heard about this attempt and read bits of it in history classes, but never really gave it much thought. I mean, the mustachioed murderer offed himself, so that was that. But what gives this film much of its umpf! is how true to history the story sticks (that and how closely many of the actors resemble their true-life counterparts). It is also riveting coming from director Bryan Singer (who did one of my all-time favorite films, THE USUAL SUSPECTS).

Tom Cruise did a great job (probably one of his best since COLLATERAL and MINORITY REPORT). His Colonel Claus von Stauffenberg character was spot-on ...with one exception that seems to be a sticking point for many: his accent. It is true that none of the actors attempts a German cadence in their speech. Did this bother me? No. I think it would have bothered me if they'd TRIED to do one and made it sound forced or ridiculous. So there's that...

What makes the film a success was Cruise's rock solid performance and the amazing supporting cast: Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson, Terrence Stamp, and Eddie Izzard just to sprinkle a few names.

It is also noteworthy to mention that they filmed nearly everything on-location and in the exact same spots where the original incidents took place, including the subsequent trials and executions of the conspirators. Phenomenal authenticity.

If the cadence of their speech bothered some, then I failed to see how the cadence of the film could. It was absolutely perfect. It gradually built up suspense (even though we knew how it would end for the conspirators), and never slowed, right up until the very end. I am forced to use a cliché here in that "I was on the edge of my seat" throughout the second half of the film.

So if you're looking to tear apart Tom Cruise, you might look at WAR OF THE WORLDS or LEGEND. But not here.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":235855,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2009-01-21","keywords":"national socialism,near miss,dilettantism,incompetence,20 july plot","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Valkyrie: Featurette -- "Through Bryan Singer's Eyes"","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3544383513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxODczMTg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODE0NTYyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxODczMTg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODE0NTYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Valkyrie: Featurette -- "Through Bryan Singer's Eyes""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000129/","name":"Tom Cruise"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631490/","name":"Bill Nighy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0396924/","name":"Carice van Houten"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001741/","name":"Bryan Singer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057712/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003160/","name":"Christopher McQuarrie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1267492/","name":"Nathan Alexander"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0985699, Title: Valkyrie, --- Description: Valkyrie: Directed by Bryan Singer. With Tom Cruise, Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson. A dramatization of the July 20, 1944 assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Adolf Hitler during World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0985699/","name":"Valkyrie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3Njc2ODEyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTAwMzc3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dramatization of the July 20, 1944 assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Adolf Hitler during World War II.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0985699/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"fwomp","dateCreated":"2010-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Critics Were Wrong...","reviewBody":""Not only is Singer's film-making aesthetically frustrating (lacking coherent visual rhythm) but his juvenile regard of the July 20, 1944, plot to kill Hitler -- one of 15 documented attempts -- is intellectually insulting..." New York Press The above is the usual negative commentary you'll see regarding this film. Critics bashed it for being insulting, unoriginal, and unmoving. Let me make some corrections for them so that they can save a little face.

I'm no Tom Cruise fan. A buddy of mine, too, is so peeved at Cruise that he refuses to watch anything the man stars in. Mostly this has to do with Cruise's personal life and beliefs (just watch an episode of South Park to see how some people view him and you'll see what I mean). People have similar feelings toward Mel Gibson ...but I digress.

VALKYRIE, as most of you probably now know, is the final of 15 attempts on Hitler's life. Shortly after this (about nine months) he committed suicide in his bunker. But this is about the one time where it almost succeeded. I'd heard about this attempt and read bits of it in history classes, but never really gave it much thought. I mean, the mustachioed murderer offed himself, so that was that. But what gives this film much of its umpf! is how true to history the story sticks (that and how closely many of the actors resemble their true-life counterparts). It is also riveting coming from director Bryan Singer (who did one of my all-time favorite films, THE USUAL SUSPECTS).

Tom Cruise did a great job (probably one of his best since COLLATERAL and MINORITY REPORT). His Colonel Claus von Stauffenberg character was spot-on ...with one exception that seems to be a sticking point for many: his accent. It is true that none of the actors attempts a German cadence in their speech. Did this bother me? No. I think it would have bothered me if they'd TRIED to do one and made it sound forced or ridiculous. So there's that...

What makes the film a success was Cruise's rock solid performance and the amazing supporting cast: Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson, Terrence Stamp, and Eddie Izzard just to sprinkle a few names.

It is also noteworthy to mention that they filmed nearly everything on-location and in the exact same spots where the original incidents took place, including the subsequent trials and executions of the conspirators. Phenomenal authenticity.

If the cadence of their speech bothered some, then I failed to see how the cadence of the film could. It was absolutely perfect. It gradually built up suspense (even though we knew how it would end for the conspirators), and never slowed, right up until the very end. I am forced to use a cliché here in that "I was on the edge of my seat" throughout the second half of the film.

So if you're looking to tear apart Tom Cruise, you might look at WAR OF THE WORLDS or LEGEND. But not here.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":235855,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2009-01-21","keywords":"national socialism,near miss,dilettantism,incompetence,20 july plot","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Valkyrie: Featurette -- "Through Bryan Singer's Eyes"","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3544383513","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxODczMTg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODE0NTYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxODczMTg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODE0NTYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Valkyrie: Featurette -- "Through Bryan Singer's Eyes"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000129/","name":"Tom Cruise","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631490/","name":"Bill Nighy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0396924/","name":"Carice van Houten"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001741/","name":"Bryan Singer"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057712/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003160/","name":"Christopher McQuarrie","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1267492/","name":"Nathan Alexander"],"duration":"PT2H1M"</script><metacontent="

Crimson Peak
programme.desc:
Crimson Peak: Directed by Guillermo del Toro. With Mia Wasikowska, Jessica Chastain, Tom Hiddleston, Charlie Hunnam. In the aftermath of a family tragedy, an aspiring author is torn between love for her childhood friend and the temptation of a mysterious outsider. Anyone familiar with some of Del Toro's other work will see a lot of his signature visual touches, which is far from being a bad thing, and the design of the ghosts was refreshingly innovative and blended into the overall visual style. The plot is interesting once it gets going, however slightly predictable. 

Sadly, there are some noticeable downsides. The most obvious one is how slowly this film starts, with seemingly very little happening for the first twenty or so minutes. The focus is very heavily on the plot, and while some characters are developed more slowly because it ties in with the plot, others can feel underdeveloped. When this is combined with the slow start, it makes the first part of this film fairly boring. Some of the chronology of this film can seem slightly strange as well, when scrutinised.

Penoza: The Final Chapter
programme.desc: Penoza: The Final Chapter: Directed by Diederik Van Rooijen. With Monic Hendrickx, Niels Gomperts, Sigrid ten Napel, Stijn Taverne. Drawn out of hiding in Canada, a Dutch former drug baroness returns to Amsterdam to face unfinished business and once and for all save her family from her life of crime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9272572/","name":"Penoza: The Final Chapter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODZiMjQ1YzQtODU1Yy00YWFkLTgwY2YtOGJjNWMwOWJkMTZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjcyMzUzNTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Drawn out of hiding in Canada, a Dutch former drug baroness returns to Amsterdam to face unfinished business and once and for all save her family from her life of crime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9272572/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dzeilstra"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Totally unrealistic","reviewBody":"I have more than once been disappointed by a film that is supposed to be some kind of summary or closure of a successful series. I enjoyed Penoza a lot as it was broadcast as a series. Nice actors, nice plot and everything within the limits of what one is prepared to accept as "for real". Not so this movie. Although the actors are the same, and still good, the story goes lightyears beyond what would be a scenario in in Holland in even a gangsters wildess dreams. Even in countries with a higher rate of criminal activity than The Netherlands the depicted events are totally unrealistic and over the top. A pity, it spoils the movie which deserves a better story line.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1505,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-11-18","keywords":"business","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0376826/","name":"Monic Hendrickx"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3463927/","name":"Niels Gomperts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3058021/","name":"Sigrid ten Napel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1082611/","name":"Diederik Van Rooijen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0241129/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1082611/","name":"Diederik Van Rooijen"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stand by Me
Stań przy mnie
Stand by Me
programme.desc:
Stand by Me: Directed by Rob Reiner. With Wil Wheaton, River Phoenix, Corey Feldman, Jerry O'Connell. After the death of one of his friends, a writer recounts a childhood journey with his friends to find the body of a missing boy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0092005/","name":"Stand by Me","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODJmY2Y2OGQtMDg2My00N2Q3LWJmZTUtYTc2ODBjZDVlNDlhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"After the death of one of his friends, a writer recounts a childhood journey with his friends to find the body of a missing boy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0092005/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jason-228"},"dateCreated":"2000-03-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Inspiration","reviewBody":"As a lover of Stephen King's writing style and Rob Reiner's directing techniques, this movie leaves me speechless every time. It is an almost forgotten film about a time and a youth nearly forgotten, as well. And I will say, as a writer, the novella that this film was based upon, "The Body" has and always will be the inspiration for my style of writing.

First of all, I enjoy the title that was chosen for the film. "Stand By Me" fits what the characters in the story are facing. I think that all who have seen this film will agree that the problems are all things that we can relate to. All of us know someone like these characters. Most of us have met the boy down the road who had a brother with a bad name and a father with an alcohol problem, automatically being labeled as a "bad kid." And the boy with the military father, abusive and a little whacko. The fat kid, picked on and ridiculed for his weight.

To me, Gordy represents all of us. I found myself seeing a little of me in Gordy as I watched the film. I don't know if any one else shares this, but it was true. Gordy was not very strong, at first, and was not sure what he wanted, except to be with his friends. Still coping with the loss of his brother and the fact that his father was disrespectful to him, Gordy still stood up for what he believed in. And, in the end he surprised the characters and the viewers by standing up to the bullies that had plagued them all.

This film is certainly one of my top favorites. In fact, it lies in my top three, probably at #2 or #3. I feel that it is a film that everyone should see at some point in their life due to the fact it changes your look at youth and their trials. Few films are able to do that and I think that this one was an inspiration for others that will do the same in the future.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":382388,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1986-08-22","keywords":"friendship,childhood,coming of age film,walking on train tracks,summertime","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stand By Me","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2284829721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzY1NmQ5YWUtMmU2OC00MzQ0LWE4YmYtYTFmNWM2ZmUxYWY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzY1NmQ5YWUtMmU2OC00MzQ0LWE4YmYtYTFmNWM2ZmUxYWY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000696/","name":"Wil Wheaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000203/","name":"River Phoenix"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000397/","name":"Corey Feldman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001661/","name":"Rob Reiner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0015549/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043140/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000175/","name":"Stephen King"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0317279/","name":"Raynold Gideon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0262595/","name":"Bruce A. Evans"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Inglourious Basterds: Directed by Quentin Tarantino. With Brad Pitt, Mélanie Laurent, Christoph Waltz, Eli Roth. In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0361748/","name":"Inglourious Basterds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTJiNDEzOWYtMTVjOC00ZjlmLWE0NGMtZmE1OWVmZDQ2OWJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0361748/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"laurabethc1"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"I can't believe I just now watched this for the first time.","reviewBody":"This is a perfect Tarantino movie. It's explosive and exciting while also deep and well thought out. It took me a minute to get used to reading so many subtitles because of the variety of languages used, but I think that's a quality that makes the movie even more enticing. It is incredibly well done and it had a hold of me from beginning to end. Fair warning for any Tarantino movie, be prepared for the gore and violence. It runs rampant throughout the movie, but it's kind of gratifying seeing it happen to the Nazis.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1345585,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Drama","War"],"datePublished":"2009-10-14","keywords":"revenge,world war two,nazi,alternate history,france","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Inglourious Basterds: International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3738173977","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzA4ZTZmMzItNmMyNS00MTk2LTg3MTgtNjYzZDBmMWJjYjMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzA4ZTZmMzItNmMyNS00MTk2LTg3MTgtNjYzZDBmMWJjYjMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"International trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000093/","name":"Brad Pitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1208167/","name":"Diane Kruger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744834/","name":"Eli Roth"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0150452/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019267/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"duration":"PT2H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rebel
Rebel
Rebel
programme.desc:
Rebel: Created by Krista Vernoff. With Katey Sagal, John Corbett, Lex Scott Davis, Tamala Jones. Follows a legal advocate with a blue collar background, who helps those in need without a law degree." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt11237708/","name":"Rebel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWI0NDM1MDMtYWY3OC00ZDc4LTliYzItMWY3YTYzZTA3NDhkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjEwNTM2Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows a legal advocate with a blue collar background, who helps those in need without a law degree.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11237708/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"veinctor"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why the negativity?","reviewBody":"Most reviews here are just biased and only the 1st episode is out! Personally I dont care who the actors are or their age. To me, even for 1st episode they established a lot of important things, like who everyone is, and the exposition wasnt too bad in my opinion.

This is a semi-serious show about a woman who wants to do good in the world. This backfires many times in the first episode, as everyone has problems with her. I find that great, as the drama is earned and moves the story forward.

Rebel also had 3 marriages and several kids, which is kind of new from my perspective, for a protagonist. Pretty much everyone in her family has an important role, like cop, lawyer, doctor etc. Which I find it to be very hilarious. It's like she has built a small army from every occupation in her disposal! This is one of the few liberties you need to give the show in order to continue. And I'm fine with that.

I can't wait for the next episode. It would be a joy to watch!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-04-08","keywords":"hero,legal","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005408/","name":"Katey Sagal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0179173/","name":"John Corbett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6280112/","name":"Lex Scott Davis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0830832/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0894628/","name":"Krista Vernoff"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1526120473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDNmYWRlMDktOTRjZS00NGMxLTgxNTAtYTUwOGJjYjc2NGNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDNmYWRlMDktOTRjZS00NGMxLTgxNTAtYTUwOGJjYjc2NGNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 11237708, Title: Rebel, --- Description: Rebel: Created by Krista Vernoff. With Katey Sagal, John Corbett, Lex Scott Davis, Tamala Jones. Follows a legal advocate with a blue collar background, who helps those in need without a law degree." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt11237708/","name":"Rebel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWI0NDM1MDMtYWY3OC00ZDc4LTliYzItMWY3YTYzZTA3NDhkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjEwNTM2Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows a legal advocate with a blue collar background, who helps those in need without a law degree.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11237708/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"veinctor","dateCreated":"2021-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why the negativity?","reviewBody":"Most reviews here are just biased and only the 1st episode is out! Personally I dont care who the actors are or their age. To me, even for 1st episode they established a lot of important things, like who everyone is, and the exposition wasnt too bad in my opinion.

This is a semi-serious show about a woman who wants to do good in the world. This backfires many times in the first episode, as everyone has problems with her. I find that great, as the drama is earned and moves the story forward.

Rebel also had 3 marriages and several kids, which is kind of new from my perspective, for a protagonist. Pretty much everyone in her family has an important role, like cop, lawyer, doctor etc. Which I find it to be very hilarious. It's like she has built a small army from every occupation in her disposal! This is one of the few liberties you need to give the show in order to continue. And I'm fine with that.

I can't wait for the next episode. It would be a joy to watch!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-04-08","keywords":"hero,legal","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005408/","name":"Katey Sagal","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0179173/","name":"John Corbett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6280112/","name":"Lex Scott Davis"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0830832/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0894628/","name":"Krista Vernoff"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1526120473","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDNmYWRlMDktOTRjZS00NGMxLTgxNTAtYTUwOGJjYjc2NGNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDNmYWRlMDktOTRjZS00NGMxLTgxNTAtYTUwOGJjYjc2NGNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 6483832, Title: The Resident, --- Description: The Resident: Created by Amy Holden Jones, Hayley Schore, Roshan Sethi. With Matt Czuchry, Manish Dayal, Bruce Greenwood, Emily VanCamp. A group of doctors at Chastain Memorial Hospital face personal and professional challenges on a daily basis." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6483832/","name":"The Resident","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc1MmE1NGYtMzFlYS00YTNmLThjNmEtMjQ5NzY4NmJkZTIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODkxMzcxOTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of doctors at Chastain Memorial Hospital face personal and professional challenges on a daily basis.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6483832/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mplesset-834-242755","dateCreated":"2018-02-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great dramatic portrayal of the deficiencies in American medical care","reviewBody":"Chillingly accurate portrayal of contemporary American medicine - driven by big money more than quality of care, insurance the determining factor for decisions, and with a veil of secrecy to cover up disasters. Quotes the true fact that preventable medical errors are the 3rd leading cause of death in the U.S., after heart disease and cancer. That all makes for great drama, but it's not an exaggeration of the situation with U.S. health care. In addition, the human relationships between the characters, both doctors and patients, are believable. The realistic accuracy of the plots makes this not just another soap opera set in a hospital, but a very compelling drama.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22973,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-01-21","keywords":"two word title,atlanta georgia,georgia,hospital,medical","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0194516/","name":"Matt Czuchry","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2110485/","name":"Manish Dayal","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339304/","name":"Bruce Greenwood"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152181/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070636/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0683032/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0427468/","name":"Amy Holden Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2735698/","name":"Hayley Schore","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6149734/","name":"Roshan Sethi"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 1 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi528529689","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2RjODYyNTMtZTljZC00ZmViLWEzZmYtZjExNmM2Y2I2MTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2RjODYyNTMtZTljZC00ZmViLWEzZmYtZjExNmM2Y2I2MTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":""The Resident" follows Dr. Conrad Hawkins, one of the best doctors at Chastain Park Memorial Hospital. programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 11242246, Title: The Equalizer, --- Description: The Equalizer: Created by Andrew W. Marlowe, Terri Edda Miller. With Queen Latifah, Tory Kittles, Adam Goldberg, Liza Lapira. An enigmatic figure who uses her extensive skills to help those with nowhere else to turn." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt11242246/","name":"The Equalizer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmY3MTgwYWUtMTc2NC00ZDdmLWIyNDAtOGJkNTQyZjM0NDA5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"An enigmatic figure who uses her extensive skills to help those with nowhere else to turn.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11242246/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"spasek","dateCreated":"2021-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"CBS Misses Again With Another Remake","reviewBody":"The only thing I was waiting for was to see Oprah show up as Queen Latifah's sidekick. Now, I'm always willing to give just about anything a try and judge for myself if something is good or not. I've certainly watched enough movies and shows that weren't nearly as bad as other critics made them out to be. I've also watched enough movies and shows that weren't nearly as good either.

Itunes had a "free episode" gimmick going with several new CBS shows. I guess CBS is trying to find a way to enhance their ratings. Perhaps they should focus on their racist decisions instead, such as giving Grace Park and Daniel Dae Kim inferior pay compared to the rest of the cast of Hawaii Five-O.

Now, I've always liked Queen Latifah, but for this series, she's badly miscast. Even after watching the pilot episode, I just couldn't buy the fact that she's a former operative with "a special set of skills," which would almost certainly mean that she would have had to have been a member of special forces. Much of her dialogue exchange with Chris Noth is about "old times" on various missions. In short, we aren't given a plausible explanation that explains her skill set, especially given her age. By the way, only as of February 2020 has a woman been set to pass the Special Forces Qualification Course.

The writing isn't very good, which is evident in the overused number of times that cliched lines are given. Also, what is the point of blasting girlie hip-hop music everytime Latifah mixes it up?

However, Latifah's performance is good, as is much of the rest of the cast. I also found her style of parenting refreshing as well.

The Equalizer would have been much more enjoyable had they focused on her intelligence of being able to out-think her opponents (which she does do a few times) and less on her--unbelievably--mixing it up like some Denzel Washington/Jason Bourne wannabe. In other words, make the show unique and give it its own identity instead of trying to imitate and copy everything that has already been done.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9453,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-02-07","keywords":"justice,fighter,woman warrior,action heroine,one woman army","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001451/","name":"Queen Latifah","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0457796/","name":"Tory Kittles","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004965/","name":"Adam Goldberg"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110950/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0448397/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0549256/","name":"Andrew W. Marlowe","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0589410/","name":"Terri Edda Miller"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Superbowl 2021 Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1113178393","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDU1MTlhY2ItNWVjZC00MzI2LWIzYWEtNDYxYjkyY2Y0ZTliXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDU1MTlhY2ItNWVjZC00MzI2LWIzYWEtNDYxYjkyY2Y0ZTliXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the series premiere of The Equalizer airing after Super Bowl LV on CBS, Academy Award nominee and multi-hyphenate Queen Latifah stars as Robyn McCall, an enigmatic former CIA operative who uses her extensive skills to help those with nowhere else to turn.

programme.title: Fanboys
Fanboys
programme.desc:
Fanboys: Directed by Kyle Newman. With Sam Huntington, Chris Marquette, Dan Fogler, Jay Baruchel. Star Wars fanatics take a cross-country trip to George Lucas' Skywalker Ranch so their dying friend can see a screening of Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999) before its release." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0489049/","name":"Fanboys","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI2MDM0NTY5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODMxMzIwMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Star Wars fanatics take a cross-country trip to George Lucas' Skywalker Ranch so their dying friend can see a screening of Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999) before its release.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0489049/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hall895"},"dateCreated":"2009-09-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Embrace your inner geek","reviewBody":"If you're a geek this movie is for you. If you're a Star Wars geek this movie totally is for you. Basically it's a movie about Star Wars geeks made by Star Wars geeks for a target audience of Star Wars geeks. If you are not into all things Star Wars this movie may well miss the mark with you. And even the most rabid of Star Wars fans would have to concede that the movie is certainly not anything spectacular. It's fairly charming and reasonably amusing but never really riotously funny. But it works. More or less.

The movie is set in the autumn of 1998, a time before Jar Jar Binks had been foisted upon the world. Four friends, major Star Wars geeks all, decide to drive across the country, break into Skywalker Ranch and steal a rough cut of The Phantom Menace. The major motivation for this journey is that one of the friends has cancer and will not live to see the movie released. But once that is established the cancer storyline is basically put on the back burner and this turns into a mostly predictable wacky road-trip comedy. Some of the wackiness works, some of it falls flat. There are a bunch of celebrity cameos thrown in, some of which are inspired and some of which are rather random and pointless. So it's a movie which has its ups and downs. But it's enjoyable more often than not and the movie breezes by in a nice, tight, well-paced 90 minutes.

None of the actors playing our gang of four really stand out in any memorable way. Dan Fogler's character is a little more outrageous than the others but that's about it. But the group works together well and they are ably supported by the varied cast of characters who pop up throughout. Seth Rogen's portrayal of a pimp is one of the standouts. Of course this ode to Star Wars fans wouldn't be complete without taking some shots at Trekkies. So there's room for another funny turn by an actor portraying Admiral Seasholtz, an uber-Trekkie. Who is the unrecognizable actor memorably bringing this character to life? You may have to wait until the closing credits roll to figure it out. And in this Star Wars geek universe there's room for one girl and Kristen Bell is both charming and funny in the role as her character gets swept along for the ride. Could the movie be a little more consistently funny? Most definitely. But the movie about Star Wars geeks will probably leave you with a smile on your face. Especially if you're a Star Wars geek yourself.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":57869,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-02-13","keywords":"star wars fan film,blonde,princess lela bikini,white panties,scantily clad female","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fanboys","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3468690201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThmODc3N2UtNzc0Ny00YWU4LTljYWEtMDNjNmQzNDJhY2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThmODc3N2UtNzc0Ny00YWU4LTljYWEtMDNjNmQzNDJhY2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer: A group of anxious fans decide to break into Skywalker Ranch and steal an early print of "Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace" for their friend who is suffering from cancer."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0283945/","name":"Dan Fogler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0059431/","name":"Jay Baruchel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0068338/","name":"Kristen Bell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1381100/","name":"Kyle Newman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0150452/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0148949/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0244605/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2094392/","name":"Ernest Cline"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1104057/","name":"Adam F. Goldberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2144288/","name":"Dan Pulick"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Marmaduke

programme.desc:

programme.title: Collateral
Zakładnik
Collateral
programme.desc:
Collateral: Directed by Michael Mann. With Tom Cruise, Jamie Foxx, Jada Pinkett Smith, Mark Ruffalo. A cab driver finds himself the hostage of an engaging contract killer as he makes his rounds from hit to hit during one night in Los Angeles." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0369339/","name":"Collateral","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3NjM5OTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTIzMTQyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A cab driver finds himself the hostage of an engaging contract killer as he makes his rounds from hit to hit during one night in Los Angeles.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0369339/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Nazi_Fighter_David"},"dateCreated":"2007-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":""Will my existence be noted by anybody?"","reviewBody":"This is a collision of two lives All collapsed in the events of one night 

The movie starts with Vincent (Tom Cruise) arriving to L.A., a guy who just looks perfect 

Some people happen to people on purpose, in order to tell them something about their lives And they sit somewhere and share two or three lines, and they leave, and you know, your life is changed 

When Max (Jamie Foxx) first meets Vincent, it was "who cares? He was a dreamer when he said: "I just saw the woman of my dreams I'm getting married in my mind right now." Vincent says, "I want you to disconnect so that when you guy do connect, it's like day and night." And continues "I got five stops to make. Collect signatures, see some friends, and then I got a 6 a.m. out of LAX. Why don't you hang with me?" 

It's not until the offering of the money that you see really connect 

"Collateral" projects in a much deeper way into Cruise/Vincent character He can become very quiet, and we can look at the screen, and we will feel that Cruise is totally in command He's a quick draw Vincent is fast As an assassin, he must be economical in his moves 

The film focused some of the wildness, and what lurks below the surface of L.A. Just the opening shot, when we look at that cab driving out and we see the big paintings on the walls, it was just visual sophistication 

The movie is not an action story It's a compelling drama with realistic action that works for the story And it is done for an emotional reason Cruise gives a dynamic performance as the cold-blooded killer Foxx is terrific as the honest hearted guy driving a cab for twelve years, and both come together suddenly like a spike in a railroad right here in this point where things were going to change in one night Jamie Foxx finds himself in the presence of a real adversary in the form of this bumbling cab driver, who has never fired a handgun in his life","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":381792,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2004-09-08","keywords":"los angeles california,taxi driver,taxi,contract killer,driving at night","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Collateral","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi448725273","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM0MDMzNDEtNzMyNS00M2NlLWJlNDUtOTFiMGNhOWZhYzEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM0MDMzNDEtNzMyNS00M2NlLWJlNDUtOTFiMGNhOWZhYzEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000129/","name":"Tom Cruise"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004937/","name":"Jamie Foxx"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000586/","name":"Jada Pinkett Smith"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000520/","name":"Michael Mann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0064181/","name":"Stuart Beattie"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="
