programme.title: Confirmation
Nominacja
Confirmation
programme.desc:
Confirmation: Directed by Rick Famuyiwa. With Kerry Washington, Wendell Pierce, Greg Kinnear, Jeffrey Wright. Judge Clarence Thomas' nomination to the United States Supreme Court is called into question when Anita Hill, a former colleague, testifies that he sexually harassed her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4608402/","name":"Confirmation","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2MjMwMDkyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjA4MTY2ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Judge Clarence Thomas' nomination to the United States Supreme Court is called into question when Anita Hill, a former colleague, testifies that he sexually harassed her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4608402/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Quinoa1984"},"dateCreated":"2016-04-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"not great, but its story speaks volumes","reviewBody":"The bottom line with Confirmation is that it's not complex as far as the plot goes, and this is particularly if you know the history. In fall of 1991 Thurgood Marshall retired from SCOTUS, and, feeling the pressure to nominate a black man to the court, Bush picked Clarence Thomas, a man who many felt wasn't qualified for the court (as Jeffrey Wright's character says at one point, "I have students who are better qualified than Clarence Thomas"). But when asked by someone from Senator Biden's office about whether or not he should be confirmed, Anita Hill couldn't hold back and be silent and told the truth: she was sexually harassed, as far as having to hear vulgar talk about sex (i.e. "Long Dong Silver" is a thing in a court of public record, I mean Jesus), and asked out on multiple occasions. It got out to the press, she had to go testify, as did Thomas, and all this before a seemingly immovable date for the man's confirmation.

This all could have made for a compelling mini-series, or an even longer movie. What is a little disappointing about is that this is probably the best this kind of movie could be, but it's still not quite good enough, or I should say that the detail isn't exactly strong enough. Mostly I found that the depiction of Clarence Thomas not exactly weak but basic: for such a man who I may find reprehensible (from before and during his 25 past years on the court), Wendell Pierce gives Thomas as a person, and character in this story, some dignity, and Anita Wright as Clarence Thomas' wife as well. But what about anything else aside from his indignation and sad faces? What else was/is there to Thomas? 

Maybe that just wasn't the focus, and director Fumiyama (of last year's surprise critical hit Dope), wanted to keep it on the politics and especially the media - many figures who you might recognize from CNN and elsewhere in cable news pop up as younger selves - certainly keeps a good eye on that. But what does make an impact and what is certainly good to look past the flaws here, are a) Kerry Washington's performance, which is so unwavering in making Anita Hill a figure of sympathy but also aching empathy, completely stripping anything else except this woman and having to put up being solid in front of the committee. And b) how the story and movie treats the whole aspect of how equal rights were not there in 1991, and may still not be (or, to put it another way, despite the changes the struggle is ongoing), for women in this country.

Like the recent People vs OJ series, we get a story that seems to deal a lot in race - Thomas' "High tech lynching" comment that struck an emotional chord for some but was seen as being disingenuous by others - and yet it's really about how women fit it, or certainly do not, in a world full of men. Images of women and how they talk and react, every little thing that they say, is under the kind of scrutiny here that men just don't have to face, at least not to this level. Confirmation is about the representation of a woman's image in politics, in the media, in the public at large, and what that does when up against a "street fight" as one of the raging white male Republican senators says. You can read a lot into what the hearings, as seen in this story, say about the national public character, and yet it's displayed for us to see in those hearings, and the behind-the-scenes fights and digging for dirt via the Republican senators, as opposed to spelled out all the time.

Confirmation doesn't stretch entirely too far for it to be great, or quite on the level of Recount or Game Change as far as HBO original movies about hot-button/controversial political stories in this country from the modern age, but within what it tries to do, and from the acting from all the players that is never less than convincing (Kinnear, who plays a rather unsympathetic Senator Biden, who screwed up things in the hearing just as far as scheduling people to testify, is one of those), it works. I'd even watch it again if just to see how Washington pulls off the majority of her scenes.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5141,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2016-04-16","keywords":"supreme court,1990s,reference to anita hill,african american judge,black male judge","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Teaser #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3610293529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MDk5NzY3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQwODAxODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MDk5NzY3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQwODAxODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Judge Clarence Thomas' nomination to the United States' Supreme Court is called into question when former colleague, Anita Hill, testifies that he had sexually harassed her."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0913488/","name":"Kerry Washington"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0682495/","name":"Wendell Pierce"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001427/","name":"Greg Kinnear"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266622/","name":"Rick Famuyiwa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209226/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173527/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0335666/","name":"Susannah Grant"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Grand Seduction
Wielkie uwodzenie
The Grand Seduction
programme.desc: The Grand Seduction: Directed by Don McKellar. With Percy Hynes White, Sean Panting, Crystal Dawn Parsons, Brendan Gleeson. To survive, a dying Newfoundland fishing village must convince a young doctor to take up residence by any means necessary." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2319580/","name":"The Grand Seduction","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI3NTEwMjk0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUxMTI1MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"To survive, a dying Newfoundland fishing village must convince a young doctor to take up residence by any means necessary.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2319580/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wookienanny"},"dateCreated":"2013-09-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't miss this one!","reviewBody":"A great movie with a stellar cast...was lucky to see the premiere during TIFF. I haven't laughed so much throughout a movie for a long time. In fact will have to see it again to catch all of the conversations as audience was laughing so much. Surprised to hear everyone breaking out in applause at various times during the movie. Very uplifting, well worth the price of admission. Gordon Pinsent and Brendan Gleeson's parts were my favorite characters, both superbly played by these talented actors. And Taylor Kitsch in the role of Dr. Lewis was the perfect straight man (handsome too). Congrats to writers Michael Dowse and Ken Scott for drawing attention to the plight of east coasters and treating a subject which could have been depressing with humor and compassion. To survive, a dying Newfoundland fishing village must convince a young doctor to take up residence by any means necessary." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2319580/","name":"The Grand Seduction","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI3NTEwMjk0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUxMTI1MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"To survive, a dying Newfoundland fishing village must convince a young doctor to take up residence by any means necessary.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2319580/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"wookienanny","dateCreated":"2013-09-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't miss this one!","reviewBody":"A great movie with a stellar cast...was lucky to see the premiere during TIFF. I haven't laughed so much throughout a movie for a long time. In fact will have to see it again to catch all of the conversations as audience was laughing so much. Surprised to hear everyone breaking out in applause at various times during the movie. Very uplifting, well worth the price of admission. Gordon Pinsent and Brendan Gleeson's parts were my favorite characters, both superbly played by these talented actors. And Taylor Kitsch in the role of Dr. Lewis was the perfect straight man (handsome too). Congrats to writers Michael Dowse and Ken Scott for drawing attention to the plight of east coasters and treating a subject which could have been depressing with humor and compassion. programme.desc: John Oliver, jedna z najbarwniejszych postaci amerykańskiej telewizji, zaprasza na ósmy sezon show, w którym prezentuje swój punkt widzenia i komentuje wydarzenia minionego tygodnia. Porusza polityczne kwestie, które angażują uwagę wszystkich mieszkańców USA, stosuje cięte riposty i z angielskim dystansem rozbawia widzów.

programme.title: The L Word: Generation Q
The L Word: Generation Q
Słowo na L: Generacja Q
The L Word: Generation Q
programme.desc:
The L Word: Generation Q: Created by Michele Abbott, Ilene Chaiken, Kathy Greenberg, Marja-Lewis Ryan. With Jennifer Beals, Katherine Moennig, Leisha Hailey, Arienne Mandi. Bette Porter, Shane McCutcheon, and Alice Pieszecki intermingle with a younger generation of Los Angelenos experiencing love, heartbreak, sex, setbacks, and success." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7661384/","name":"The L Word: Generation Q","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc3MWM2MjMtYzM2ZC00MjhjLWE1NjYtYzMyMjM0ODUxMjQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTA3MTMyOTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bette Porter, Shane McCutcheon, and Alice Pieszecki intermingle with a younger generation of Los Angelenos experiencing love, heartbreak, sex, setbacks, and success.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7661384/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"catsy29"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"What the F word with this backlash? The L Word is back and it's not bad at all!","reviewBody":"The L Word changed my life. I was a very confused 14 year Colombian girl living in a very small city with my very Catholic family. I was not old enough to watch the show but fk it, I finally understood why I felt out of place and I didn't "get it" when my friends talked about some "boy being super hot". I realized that I was, and I am, lesbian. I know the show ended up being crap. But we can't let the bad things overshadow what this show meant, and still means, to people like me.

My girlfriend and I were afraid of watching this new generation, we were afraid of watching a disaster even worse that what ended up to be the original show. We were afraid that "The L Word", the lesbian word, would fall in the background. I am not against the Q generation, but I do feel that we lesbians all around the world are losing great spaces like for example: all women, lesbian bars. I love that today, people are not afraid of putting on, or not to putting on, a label. But we need The L Word right now more than ever. You can see for yourself. Search how many lesbian bars have disappeared all around the globe in the last 10 years, it's sad. There are just a couple left.

I just watched the first 2 episodes and I feel so happy. I am feeling like a teenager, watching the show on mute with the captions on, every Sunday at 11pm on school's nights. Feeling scared and happy at the same time. Waiting the whole week just for that one hour of television where I could watch women like me. We did exist! I was not the only one!

 I think the choices they made with the old characters are great. I think this new show is very smart and it keeps the essence of the first seasons of the original one. I am very happy with this transition.

I really want this show to succeed. I want to know more about the old characters, I want cameos. But also, I want to know more about the new characters. I am very excited and enjoyed the hell out of these episodes.

Yeah, the show is silly sometimes but it doesn't take itself too seriously and shouldn't we. This show was and still is groundbreaking, it's tone varies but the message is very clear.

I am very glad Jennifer, Leisha and Kate did this. And I am so happy that they are the producers and have a lot of creative power. They can't let Ilene Chaiken ruin this again.

Watch it. I was not going to to do it because of the reviews and that is so stupid. Just give it an opportunity.

I love this cast, they have great chemistry.

This show is not about fixing the mistakes made in the past. They can't resurrect Dana and, they actually did a great job with the Jenny situation....one line was more than enough to end that mess.

I hope to get a lot of more seasons. Why the LGBTQ+ community hates the LGBTQ+ community so much?

Like for real. I don't get why anyone can be pissed at this show. Just don't watch it if you don't like it but you can't say it's not a great deal for our community and for us, lesbians.

Lesbian, from Lesbos. The origin of the L word is beautiful. Read about Sappho, read her poems. We should be proud of it and we should celebrate it.

We need more shows like this. Visibility is our best allied, don't forget that.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5372,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-08","keywords":"lesbian","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000884/","name":"Jennifer Beals"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0595485/","name":"Katherine Moennig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0354157/","name":"Leisha Hailey"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0886561/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052980/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1271093/","name":"Michele Abbott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149669/","name":"Ilene Chaiken"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1271884/","name":"Kathy Greenberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 2 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3625959449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmYzNGQzZjQtZGYxOS00OTRiLTg2ZDEtYzhhMmQzYzU5NjMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmYzNGQzZjQtZGYxOS00OTRiLTg2ZDEtYzhhMmQzYzU5NjMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Season 2 is available to stream August 6, 2021 on SHOWTIME."}}</script><metacontent="

Edge of Tomorrow
programme.desc: Edge of Tomorrow: Directed by Doug Liman. With Tom Cruise, Emily Blunt, Brendan Gleeson, Bill Paxton. programme.desc: You Belong to Me: Directed by Vaughn Stein. With Casey Affleck, Michelle Monaghan, Sam Claflin, Veronica Ferres. A psychiatrist, whose client commits suicide, finds his family life disrupted after introducing her surviving brother to his wife and daughter." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2231874/","name":"You Belong to Me","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDc0YzQ0YzEtM2YzMC00OGYxLTkxYjEtYmVmZmE1M2RiOWNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAyMjQ3NzQ1._V1_.jpg","description":"A psychiatrist, whose client commits suicide, finds his family life disrupted after introducing her surviving brother to his wife and daughter.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2231874/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"varun-25071997"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice Concept But Poor Execution","reviewBody":"A nice story executed in the worst possible way. Two talented lead actors completely wasted and the casting of Sam Claffin was so bad on many levels. It starts like your usual revenge story but the "twist" in the end which is theoretically good falls so flat because of the pace of the film. The film felt 3 hours long for its 105 minute runtime. This is a story that deserves to be a gripping thriller but it was shot like some tragedy. Sam Claffin's performance as the antagonist is one of the worst you will ever see this year.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3767,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2021-10-07","keywords":"brother,cheating wife,adulterous wife,car accident,hockey rink","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3584868377","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDBmNjhmM2ItYWU5YS00NTUxLWEyMDYtOTQ2N2I2Nzk4MTQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDBmNjhmM2ItYWU5YS00NTUxLWEyMDYtOTQ2N2I2Nzk4MTQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Every Breath You Take is a searing psychological thriller about a psychiatrist (Casey Affleck), whose career is thrown into jeopardy when his patient takes her own life. When he invites his patient’s surviving brother (Sam Claflin) into his home to meet his wife (Michelle Monaghan) and daughter, his family life is suddenly torn apart."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000729/","name":"Casey Affleck"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157358/","name":"Michelle Monaghan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3510471/","name":"Sam Claflin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2389363/","name":"Vaughn Stein"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0447556/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0164806/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110945/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2733268/","name":"David Murray"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: True Detective
True Detective
Detektyw
True Detective
programme.desc:
True Detective: Created by Nic Pizzolatto. With Matthew McConaughey, Colin Farrell, Mahershala Ali, Woody Harrelson. Seasonal anthology series in which police investigations unearth the personal and professional secrets of those involved, both within and outside the law." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2356777/","name":"True Detective","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMGM2ZmYtZGEyZC00OWQyLWI2Y2QtMTdjYzMxZGJmNjhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU2ODM5MjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Seasonal anthology series in which police investigations unearth the personal and professional secrets of those involved, both within and outside the law.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2356777/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ben-harbak"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't Listen to Me, or Anyone Else","reviewBody":"Watch the show and make up your own mind. I've seen too many people regurgitating the same "SEASON 1 IS AMAZING, SEASON 2 IS THE WORST OF ALL TIME" junk, and it's simply not true.

Fact of the matter is this is an anthology series. Different people, different stories, different feels. If they wanted a show with 3 seasons of Matthew McConaughey and Woody Harrelson, they would have done that.

Some detective stories are eerie and disturbing. Some are broody and slow burning. Season 2 is the latter, and all the hate it gets for basically not being exactly like the first season detracts from the performances and character arcs within.

There are also a lot of complaints about Vince Vaughn? Aside from some stiff writing, I hardly see the issue. He's got some great scene-chewing moments as a brutal crime boss!

I honestly can't believe some publications labeled this as one of the worst seasons of television in 2015. Just goes to show that some people have no clue how to manage their expectations, and this site is no different. Look at what I've said, and now put it up against so many here...it's ridiculous.

Like I said: watch it and make up your own mind. I avoided it for 5 years because of this site and I regret it. Season 2 isn't season 1, just like season 3 isn't 1 or 2. If you want the same thing over and over again, watch CSI.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":526978,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.9},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2014-01-12","keywords":"police investigation,police detective,southern gothic,murder,anthology","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000681/","name":"Vince Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268199/","name":"Colin Farrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1046097/","name":"Rachel McAdams"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017525/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0284741/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176737/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4446305/","name":"Nic Pizzolatto"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2747906585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGEwZjVkYjQtMDVmMS00MDZmLWFhMjUtOTFmN2QwMzIxN2VhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGEwZjVkYjQtMDVmMS00MDZmLWFhMjUtOTFmN2QwMzIxN2VhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""True Detective" returns January 13, 2019 on HBO. The third season, starring Mahershala Ali and Stephen Dorff, sees detectives investigating a grisly crime involving two missing children in the heart of the Ozarks."}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 2356777, Title: True Detective, --- Description: True Detective: Created by Nic Pizzolatto. With Matthew McConaughey, Colin Farrell, Mahershala Ali, Woody Harrelson. Seasonal anthology series in which police investigations unearth the personal and professional secrets of those involved, both within and outside the law." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2356777/","name":"True Detective","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMGM2ZmYtZGEyZC00OWQyLWI2Y2QtMTdjYzMxZGJmNjhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU2ODM5MjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Seasonal anthology series in which police investigations unearth the personal and professional secrets of those involved, both within and outside the law.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2356777/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ben-harbak","dateCreated":"2020-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't Listen to Me, or Anyone Else","reviewBody":"Watch the show and make up your own mind. I've seen too many people regurgitating the same "SEASON 1 IS AMAZING, SEASON 2 IS THE WORST OF ALL TIME" junk, and it's simply not true.

Fact of the matter is this is an anthology series. Different people, different stories, different feels. If they wanted a show with 3 seasons of Matthew McConaughey and Woody Harrelson, they would have done that.

Some detective stories are eerie and disturbing. Some are broody and slow burning. Season 2 is the latter, and all the hate it gets for basically not being exactly like the first season detracts from the performances and character arcs within.

There are also a lot of complaints about Vince Vaughn? Aside from some stiff writing, I hardly see the issue. He's got some great scene-chewing moments as a brutal crime boss!

I honestly can't believe some publications labeled this as one of the worst seasons of television in 2015. Just goes to show that some people have no clue how to manage their expectations, and this site is no different. Look at what I've said, and now put it up against so many here...it's ridiculous.

Like I said: watch it and make up your own mind. I avoided it for 5 years because of this site and I regret it. Season 2 isn't season 1, just like season 3 isn't 1 or 2. programme.title: Dystopia
Dystopia
Dystopia
programme.desc:
Dystopia: With Lola Zackow, Madeleine Martin, Johan Hafezi, Erik Bolin. Group of Swedes, get into an abandoned factory deep in the wilderness for a live roleplay to push their physical and mental limits. Game turns dead serious when series of mysteries unfold, awakening dark forces in each of them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt14111834/","name":"Dystopia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzM3NDZhZmEtZjY3NS00NGIxLTg1NWMtNmRjZjQ4NDk2YTFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzY0MTE3NzU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Group of Swedes, get into an abandoned factory deep in the wilderness for a live roleplay to push their physical and mental limits. Game turns dead serious when series of mysteries unfold, awakening dark forces in each of them.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt14111834/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"music-richardmichaelsson"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Creepy, unsettling and best Swedish TV-series in Years","reviewBody":"I'll say right off the bat, I didn't really know who some of these Swedish actors were but as a resident of Sweden since a while back I had seen Johan Hedenberg. A wonderful actor.

What struck me right away was the extremely good, scored intro, the music throughout Dystopia is of I am a genuine fan of classic horror, so I was a bit suspicious when I heard VIAPLAY was doing Dystopia but boy was I surprised for a number of reasons.

The first is it kept me wondering what exactly was going on. There was just enough there to build atmosphere and tension without giving away the surprise. And it was delivered with such skill and care that it truly unfolded masterfully. You know something is wrong. You know something is up. But you can't quite figure out what it is. The Director of Dystopia is Richard Jarnhed and I need to keep an eye out for his future endeavors as he is madly talented.

And secondly this was directed by just one director. Richard directed all 8 episodes and that's not normal in Scandinavia.

And lastly, it gave us something new. This is possibly the best aspect because I am sick to death of cookie cutter horror movies. People nowadays have forgotten that horror doesn't just mean blood and guts. Before directors had to create tension and atmosphere by building the plot and unraveling the story slowly. It's refreshing to see this done with such care.

The acting is wonderful and directing is amazing. I was totally blown away by the music!

It is always nice to see a TV-series with some twists, and also those that give you some food for thought.

I am a bit blown away by the rather week reviews in Swedish press. One outlet even writes that it's outside the box and that they love the box. I am sure Dystopia will do very well internationally!

If you like Horror tension and at the same time mystery tension you should see Dystopia.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2300,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"2021-06-13","keywords":"lesbian kiss,lesbian sex,topless female nudity,larp,larpers","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11198177/","name":"Lola Zackow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4477198/","name":"Madeleine Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7154476/","name":"Johan Hafezi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0004517/"}]}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 14111834, Title: Dystopia, --- Description: Dystopia: With Lola Zackow, Madeleine Martin, Johan Hafezi, Erik Bolin. Group of Swedes, get into an abandoned factory deep in the wilderness for a live roleplay to push their physical and mental limits. Game turns dead serious when series of mysteries unfold, awakening dark forces in each of them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt14111834/","name":"Dystopia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzM3NDZhZmEtZjY3NS00NGIxLTg1NWMtNmRjZjQ4NDk2YTFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzY0MTE3NzU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Group of Swedes, get into an abandoned factory deep in the wilderness for a live roleplay to push their physical and mental limits. Game turns dead serious when series of mysteries unfold, awakening dark forces in each of them.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt14111834/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"music-richardmichaelsson","dateCreated":"2021-06-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Creepy, unsettling and best Swedish TV-series in Years","reviewBody":"I'll say right off the bat, I didn't really know who some of these Swedish actors were but as a resident of Sweden since a while back I had seen Johan Hedenberg. A wonderful actor.

What struck me right away was the extremely good, scored intro, the music throughout Dystopia is of I am a genuine fan of classic horror, so I was a bit suspicious when I heard VIAPLAY was doing Dystopia but boy was I surprised for a number of reasons.

The first is it kept me wondering what exactly was going on. There was just enough there to build atmosphere and tension without giving away the surprise. And it was delivered with such skill and care that it truly unfolded masterfully. You know something is wrong. You know something is up. But you can't quite figure out what it is. The Director of Dystopia is Richard Jarnhed and I need to keep an eye out for his future endeavors as he is madly talented.

And secondly this was directed by just one director. Richard directed all 8 episodes and that's not normal in Scandinavia.

And lastly, it gave us something new. This is possibly the best aspect because I am sick to death of cookie cutter horror movies. People nowadays have forgotten that horror doesn't just mean blood and guts. Before directors had to create tension and atmosphere by building the plot and unraveling the story slowly. It's refreshing to see this done with such care.

The acting is wonderful and directing is amazing. I was totally blown away by the music!

It is always nice to see a TV-series with some twists, and also those that give you some food for thought.

I am a bit blown away by the rather week reviews in Swedish press. One outlet even writes that it's outside the box and that they love the box. I am sure Dystopia will do very well internationally!

If you like Horror tension and at the same time mystery tension you should see Dystopia.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2300,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"2021-06-13","keywords":"lesbian kiss,lesbian sex,topless female nudity,larp,larpers","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11198177/","name":"Lola Zackow","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4477198/","name":"Madeleine Martin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7154476/","name":"Johan Hafezi"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0004517/"]</script><metacontent="

Resident Evil
programme.desc: Resident Evil: Directed by Paul W.S. Anderson. With Ryan McCluskey, Oscar Pearce, Indra Ové, Anna Bolt. A special military unit fights a powerful, out-of-control supercomputer and hundreds of scientists who have mutated into flesh-eating creatures after a laboratory accident." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120804/","name":"Resident Evil","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmI1ZGRhNDYtOGVjZC00MmUyLThlNTktMTQyZGE3MzE1ZTdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDE5MTU2MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A special military unit fights a powerful, out-of-control supercomputer and hundreds of scientists who have mutated into flesh-eating creatures after a laboratory accident.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120804/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cherold"},"dateCreated":"2003-10-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finally, a video game adaption done right","reviewBody":"This movie means business. Quick disaster with a mystery to it, jarring deaths, naked Milla, all in the first few minutes. It keeps up the pace throughout. In terms of critical comments, yes, you don't really care about the characters, but so what? How often do you really care about the monster fodder in horror films? And true, it wasn't a literal working of the movie, it didn't take place in a mansion and it didn't involve exploring lots of rooms and solving puzzles. That's because it's a movie. A literal translation of Resident Evil would probably be really dull. Games and movies are very different mediums. I don't think some people here understand that. One guy said he thought the movie rocked but after repeated viewings he thought it sucked, and that's a video game player attitude - movies don't have to have good replay value, it's okay to enjoy them once. I only enjoyed Star Wars once, but I don't think it sucked, it just didn't have a lot of depth. Not every movie has to be Citizen Kane. \n\nIt was an engaging story, moved like lightning and had some excellent scares.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":258912,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2002-08-28","keywords":"doberman,cut into pieces,zombie,commando,kissing while having sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Resident Evil","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2894266649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjI4NDZjNWUtNDBkMy00ZTY5LWJkMjEtMmFhZWIxZjAyZjMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjI4NDZjNWUtNDBkMy00ZTY5LWJkMjEtMmFhZWIxZjAyZjMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000170/","name":"Milla Jovovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735442/","name":"Michelle Rodriguez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011675/","name":"Ryan McCluskey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027271/","name":"Paul W.S. A rescue crew investigates a spaceship that disappeared into a black hole and has now returned...with someone or something new on-board." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119081/","name":"Event Horizon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGI0NDMwNjAtNGEzNC00MzA1LTlkMjQtYjBkYTZlZjAyZWEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A rescue crew investigates a spaceship that disappeared into a black hole and has now returned...with someone or something new on-board.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119081/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"allofdarknessin1"},"dateCreated":"2017-05-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very good sci/fi horror mix that does more than jump scares or lots of clichés","reviewBody":"I've never written a review before on IMDb but I had to write one for this movie, I thought it was a very standout movie for its time. I'm not a fan of horror movies not because they scare me but because of reused clichés and cliché characters.\n\nIt might not seem like a very important movie based on ratings or it's own trailer but I felt there was a great mix of atmosphere ,survival, horror, suspense with Sci/Fi bridging a gap to a touch of super natural(depends on how you view the outcome as it could just be Sci/Fi only) I felt the movie didn't go crazy with jump scares , it creeped me out but provided an entertaining premise as well. I'd highly recommend this movie if you haven't seen it unless you're not a fan of Sci/Fi or survival"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":169896,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1997-08-15","keywords":"spaceship,astronaut,black hole,hell,female astronaut","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Event Horizon","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1179583001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JjYzFiOWUtZjk1Ny00YzIwLThiMzQtODhmNDAzMDkwYWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JjYzFiOWUtZjk1Ny00YzIwLThiMzQtODhmNDAzMDkwYWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000401/","name":"Laurence Fishburne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000554/","name":"Sam Neill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000599/","name":"Kathleen Quinlan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027271/","name":"Paul W.S. Casanova's Big Night
programme.desc: Casanova's Big Night: Directed by Norman Z. McLeod. With Bob Hope, Joan Fontaine, Audrey Dalton, Basil Rathbone. A meek tailor thinks his wooing will be helped if he assumes the identity of the famous Casanova...who's deeply in debt." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0046834/","name":"Casanova's Big Night","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGQxOTA5MTYtNmIyZS00YWFkLThjNzUtNmQ3ODU2MWE0ZWE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDUyOTUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A meek tailor thinks his wooing will be helped if he assumes the identity of the famous Casanova...who's deeply in debt.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0046834/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lonniebealeusa"},"dateCreated":"2002-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"classic Bob Hope movie","reviewBody":"What a treat to see Bob impersonate the greatest of all lovers-Casanova. This is a wonderfully entertaining movie which keeps you amused throughout the entire film.Basil Rathbone as usual up to top form. Did he ever play anything but a scoundrel in all his movies? There are so many highlights it is difficult to choose any favorites,but the best would be at the end of the movie when Hope as Casanova is to be executed and appeals to the movie audience to spare him ,is one of the funniest scenes ever done.Next time you go to the movies take some popcorn with you and we may be able to save Bob from a fate worse than death."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1038,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1954-04-12","keywords":"casanova character,psychotronic film,blonde woman,tailor,italy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001362/","name":"Bob Hope"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000021/","name":"Joan Fontaine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0198241/","name":"Audrey Dalton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0572851/","name":"Norman Z. programme.title: Long Day's Journey Into Night
U kresu dnia
Long Day's Journey Into Night
programme.desc: Long Day's Journey Into Night: Directed by Sidney Lumet. With Katharine Hepburn, Ralph Richardson, Jason Robards, Dean Stockwell. At the end of a long and hot summer day, members of one family gather in a large house. Everyone has something painful and offensive to say, and their silence is even worse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0056196/","name":"Long Day's Journey Into Night","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNiMjdmYzYtYjQwOC00NWE5LTk5NzktZDUwM2UwNDY4MmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUxODE0MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the end of a long and hot summer day, members of one family gather in a large house. Everyone has something painful and offensive to say, and their silence is even worse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0056196/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ROCKY-19"},"dateCreated":"1999-01-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"A fine translation of the play","reviewBody":"This is a typically dark, fine-grained O'Neill work that becomes almost overwhelmed with its own moodiness. Hepburn plumbs some psychological depths here as the drug-addicted mother. Richardson is fine as well, but it is disappointing that double-Oscar winner Fredric March, who won a Tony for the role on Broadway, did not play Tyrone is the screen version. We do get to see Jason Robards recreate his role, and his experience clearly comes through. This is continually penetrating vision of a family that perhaps is not as dysfunctional as "normal" families would like to believe. A disturbing film well worth seeing."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4978,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1963-11-27","keywords":"actor,irish,tuberculosis,drug addiction,alcoholism","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Long Day's Journey Into Night","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3914579737","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRhY2Q2OTItN2JlNi00NDRlLTk1MTUtZTg5NGZmNzBhOGYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRhY2Q2OTItN2JlNi00NDRlLTk1MTUtZTg5NGZmNzBhOGYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000031/","name":"Katharine Hepburn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0724732/","name":"Ralph Richardson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001673/","name":"Jason Robards"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001486/","name":"Sidney Lumet"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0550985/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0642156/","name":"Eugene O'Neill"}],"duration":"PT2H54M"}</script><metacontent="

Hotel for Dogs
programme.desc:
Hotel for Dogs: Directed by Thor Freudenthal. With Emma Roberts, Jake T. Austin, Don Cheadle, Johnny Simmons. Two kids secretly take in stray dogs at a vacant hotel." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0785006/","name":"Hotel for Dogs","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5NjkxOTE5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTcxNTAwMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two kids secretly take in stray dogs at a vacant hotel.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0785006/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LazySod"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good laugh for the kids","reviewBody":"A brother and sister live with their umpteenth set of foster parents. They hide their pet - a small dog - because the foster parents don't want to know about it. When the dog runs away they follow it and find their way into an old abandoned building. To their surprise it is not completely abandoned but actually lived in by a number of dogs. Soon after that an idea comes to life.

And from there the story rolls on in a typical Disney style children's film where evil is evil and good is good and anything else is easily forgotten. As as adult I wasn't overly impressed with the film but the kid I took to see it loved it - and that's good. The target audience for the film must be kids in the age range 6 to 12 or so. The things that happen are fun to watch (at least the very most of the time) and although the acting capabilities of the younger players leaves something to be desired it is not bad enough to turn the film into a complete waste of tape.

All in all, it features a good number of laughs, a few tear drops and surely a lot of hard work - and a cast that is clearly liking to play the roles they were cast for.

5 out of 10 dogs barking in the night","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22782,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2009-03-18","keywords":"overalls,male and female protagonists,older sister younger brother relationship,2000s,canadian dog","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hotel for Dogs: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3092774937","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI0ODkwNDU5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTg1NDIwMg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI0ODkwNDU5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTg1NDIwMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of kids secretly turn a vacant hotel into a shelter for stray dogs."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731075/","name":"Emma Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1545471/","name":"Jake T. programme.title: Dinner for Schmucks
Kolacja dla palantów
Dinner for Schmucks
programme.desc:
Dinner for Schmucks: Directed by Jay Roach. With Steve Carell, Paul Rudd, Zach Galifianakis, Jemaine Clement. When he finds out that his work superiors host a dinner celebrating the idiocy of their guests, a rising executive questions it when he's invited, just as he befriends a man who would be the perfect guest." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0427152/","name":"Dinner for Schmucks","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk5MTYzNTIyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTM3MTQ2Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When he finds out that his work superiors host a dinner celebrating the idiocy of their guests, a rising executive questions it when he's invited, just as he befriends a man who would be the perfect guest.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0427152/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"The_Film_Cricket"},"dateCreated":"2011-03-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spotty comedy, saved by Carrell's brilliant performance","reviewBody":"I think it was the great comedian Edmund Gwenn who made the statement that "Dying is easy, comedy is hard." That is probably true but I am convinced that there are some actors who can make comedy look easy. At his best, Steve Carrell does just that. In 'Dinner for Schmucks' he occupies the role of Barry Speck, a blithering idiot for whom life is a jolly holiday and cynicism is a notion that seems to have passed him over. Barry's view of the world is devoid of irony or whimsy, he stares blankly with wide eyes and a stupid grin and never seems to understand what is happening right in front of him.

Let me give you an example. Near the beginning of the movie, Barry is being seduced by a blond bimbo who tells him that she thinks she needs a spanking. We get this exchange: 

The Blond: "I'm a naughty school girl. I've been bad." Barry: "You look a little old to be a school girl" The Blond: "You're my schoolmaster. I need to be punished." Barry: "I'm not really qualified for that. I work for the IRS."

That kind of idiocy makes Barry the perfect tool for Tim Conrad (Paul Rudd), a mid-level financial executive who curries favor with his implacable boss Lance Fender (Bruce Greenwood) when he manages to sell a Swiss billionaire on the idea of turning defective bombs into effective, yet unattractive, lamps. Fender is impressed and invites Tim to an annual dinner party at his mansion, a "Dinner for Winners" in which the purpose is for each guest to bring the biggest idiot they can find. The guest with the most entertaining idiot wins a trophy.

The journey getting to that dinner party mostly involves Tim trying to survive Barry's idiocy. He has a way of saying and doing the most outrageous things while maintaining a demeanor that lets us believe that he hasn't the slightest clue that his behavior is the least bit odd, even his hobby of making cute dioramas with dead mice.

The first half of the film is genuinely funny, as it observes Barry and his world as he looks out with wide eyes, a goofy smile. Yet, the rest of the movie is spotty. Once we get to know Barry, the movie tries to mix a riot of slapstick comedy with moments of sentimentality that are mostly made up of half-baked speeches about the value of friendship.

The third act gets the film back on track somewhat as we finally arrive at that dinner party. What works are the simple observations about Barry and the other morons in attendance (one of whom is Jeff Dunham who is in a marital spat with one of his dummies). Those characters are funny but the scene goes overboard with a very long battle involving Barry and a nitwit mind-reader named Thurman Munch (Zach Galifianakis) who wears Dickies over his shirts and has a self-satisfied autobiography called "Your Mind Is My Puppet". The scene quickly spirals into a very bizarre area reminiscent of some of Monty Python's lesser sketches.

Steve Carrell is the the entire reason for seeing 'Dinner for Schmucks'. His wonderful performance is pitch perfect, playing a lovable dolt who genuinely believes what he says, even when he confesses to Tim that the reason his wife left his that "I lost her clitoris". To see the deadpan look in his eyes is to understand that Barry believes this statement completely. It is also possibly to understand why his wife really left him.

*** (of four)"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":104328,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2010-10-13","keywords":"smashing a bottle against a wall,wine,hairy chested male,man wears eyeglasses,remake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Dinner for Schmucks: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3797747481","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTczMjMzMzYyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTUyNjMzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTczMjMzMzYyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTUyNjMzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Tim (Rudd) is a rising executive who "succeeds" in finding the perfect guest, IRS employee Barry (Carell), for his boss's monthly event, a so-called "dinner for idiots," which offers certain advantages to the exec who shows up with the biggest buffoon."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0136797/","name":"Steve Carell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0748620/","name":"Paul Rudd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1210895/","name":"Stephanie Szostak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005366/","name":"Jay Roach"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031181/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1115862/","name":"David Guion"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1911349/","name":"Michael Handelman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891554/","name":"Francis Veber"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Tropic Thunder
Jaja w tropikach
Tropic Thunder
programme.desc:
Tropic Thunder: Directed by Ben Stiller. With Jeff Kahn, Robert Downey Jr., Anthony Ruivivar, Jack Black. Through a series of freak occurrences, a group of actors shooting a big-budget war movie are forced to become the soldiers they are portraying." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0942385/","name":"Tropic Thunder","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDE5NjQzMDkzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODI3ODI3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Through a series of freak occurrences, a group of actors shooting a big-budget war movie are forced to become the soldiers they are portraying.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0942385/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"djgali21"},"dateCreated":"2019-04-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"11 years later, it still holds up to me","reviewBody":"I saw this movie in theaters and fell in love with it. I've seen it many times throughout the years and have noticed most people either don't know or don't care for this film. After rewatching it yesterday, I just had to write about it.

The casting was incredible in my opinion. People think of Ocean's Eleven or The Departed as movies with dream casts. I think Tropic Thunder holds its own. Tom Cruise and Matthew McConaughey are solid minor/supporting characters. I'm not a fan of Tom Cruise, but I find myself quoting all of his Les Grossman lines consistently. Nick Nolte, Steve Coogan, Bill Hader and Danny McBride are great additions. Jay Baruchel is his usual self, Brandon T Jackson was a solid part of the mix and the three main leads really deliver. Special mention to RDJ, by far my favorite performance. It's ridiculous how many layers there are to his character. At some point he's an Australian actor playing a Black guy playing an Asian farmer.

Almost every single scene has a quotable line. The action is very well done and the story's so wonderfully over the top.

I think the biggest win is how well it has aged in my opinion. Movies like The Hangover were really funny when they came out, but I find there's no replay value. The jokes don't work well the second time around. The same goes for something like Deadpool. On the other hand, films like Borat, Anchorman and Tropic Thunder still make me laugh regardless of how many times I've seen it.

I wish Ben Stiller would go back to doing stuff like this. programme.review: --- Actors: Jeff Kahn (role=Snooty Waiter - Fatties Trailer), Robert Downey Jr. (role=Kirk Lazarus - Hot LZ), Anthony Ruivivar (role=Platoon Sergeant Shot in Head - Hot LZ), Jack Black (role=Jeff Portnoy - Hot LZ), Jay Baruchel (role=Kevin Sandusky - Hot LZ), Brandon T. Jackson (role=Alpa Chino - Hot LZ), Ben Stiller (role=Tugg Speedman - Hot LZ), Eric Winzenried (role=Chopper Pilot - Hot LZ), Steve Coogan (role=Damien Cockburn - Vietnam Crew), Valerie Azlynn (role=Damien's Assistant - Vietnam Crew), Matt Levin (role=Cameraperson - Vietnam Crew), David Pressman (role=First Assistant Director - Vietnam Crew)

IMDb data; ttnr: 0942385, Title: Tropic Thunder, --- Description: Tropic Thunder: Directed by Ben Stiller. With Jeff Kahn, Robert Downey Jr., Anthony Ruivivar, Jack Black. Through a series of freak occurrences, a group of actors shooting a big-budget war movie are forced to become the soldiers they are portraying." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0942385/","name":"Tropic Thunder","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDE5NjQzMDkzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODI3ODI3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Through a series of freak occurrences, a group of actors shooting a big-budget war movie are forced to become the soldiers they are portraying.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0942385/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"djgali21","dateCreated":"2019-04-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"11 years later, it still holds up to me","reviewBody":"I saw this movie in theaters and fell in love with it. I've seen it many times throughout the years and have noticed most people either don't know or don't care for this film. After rewatching it yesterday, I just had to write about it.

The casting was incredible in my opinion. People think of Ocean's Eleven or The Departed as movies with dream casts. I think Tropic Thunder holds its own. Tom Cruise and Matthew McConaughey are solid minor/supporting characters. I'm not a fan of Tom Cruise, but I find myself quoting all of his Les Grossman lines consistently. Nick Nolte, Steve Coogan, Bill Hader and Danny McBride are great additions. Jay Baruchel is his usual self, Brandon T Jackson was a solid part of the mix and the three main leads really deliver. Special mention to RDJ, by far my favorite performance. It's ridiculous how many layers there are to his character. At some point he's an Australian actor playing a Black guy playing an Asian farmer.

Almost every single scene has a quotable line. The action is very well done and the story's so wonderfully over the top.

I think the biggest win is how well it has aged in my opinion. Movies like The Hangover were really funny when they came out, but I find there's no replay value. The jokes don't work well the second time around. The same goes for something like Deadpool. On the other hand, films like Borat, Anchorman and Tropic Thunder still make me laugh regardless of how many times I've seen it.

I wish Ben Stiller would go back to doing stuff like this. A Les Grossman sequel would've been absolutely incredible!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":396788,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","War"],"datePublished":"2008-08-20","keywords":"film within a film,parody,vietnam,helicopter crash,fake trailer","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tropic Thunder","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2139141657","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3OTk1MzYzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU2NDkxMDI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3OTk1MzYzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU2NDkxMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Tropic","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085312/","name":"Jack Black","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000375/","name":"Robert Downey Jr."],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039303/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0245613/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0857620/","name":"Justin Theroux","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1000113/","name":"Etan Cohen"],"duration":"PT1H47M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Two for the Money
Podwójna gra
Two for the Money
programme.desc:
Two for the Money: Directed by D.J. Caruso. With Al Pacino, Matthew McConaughey, Rene Russo, Armand Assante. After suffering a career-ending knee injury, a former college football star aligns himself with one of the most renowned touts in the sports-gambling business." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0417217/","name":"Two for the Money","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODAzOTAzNzkyNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMTAzNjM3._V1_.jpg","description":"After suffering a career-ending knee injury, a former college football star aligns himself with one of the most renowned touts in the sports-gambling business.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0417217/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"christian123"},"dateCreated":"2006-04-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Al Pacino is always worth betting on.","reviewBody":"Mathew McConaughey is Brandon Lane, a former football star recruited by Walter Abraham (Al Pacino), the head of a sports consulting firm to help them set the line for their sports betting business. Lane's ability to predict the outcome of games quickly turns him into a golden boy, but it soon becomes apparent that he's bitten off more than he can chew when his abilities start to falter.

Two for the Money is a forgettable, generic thriller that doesn't really offer anything new. The film does have some entertaining moments and the first half of the movie is actually pretty exciting to watch. But, the second half is really slow and very tedious. It just drags on and on and for no reason either. It could have been a nice 90 minute movie but the story is stretched out into a two hour film. Luckily, Al Pacino is in the movie and he keeps the film exciting. He gives a good, over the top performance and he pretty much raises the film up to mediocrity. Personally, sports betting isn't that interesting to me but Al Pacino makes it interesting. He can turn a bad script into an okay movie which is what he does with the film. Let's be honest, the script is not very good and the direction is weak. It's so obvious where things are going which is not surprising because this is the same guy that made Taking Lives.

Al Pacino is playing mentor to Matthew McConaughey and their chemistry together isn't very strong. McConaughey is a pretty weak actor and he can't keep up with Pacino. The lead role should have gone to someone else. Rene Russo is okay as Pacino's wife. She gives a decent performance but she was a little too bland to truly stand out. Another thing about the film that people may not like is that every character is unlikable. It's hard to care for these characters because they are either pretty mean or bland. It didn't really bother me because I watched the film to be entertained and I did get some entertainment value from the movie. In the end, if you like Al Pacino then you should give the film a shot, if you don't then just skip it. Rating 6/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45067,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"2006-11-29","keywords":"father son relationship,female frontal nudity,football,injury,addiction","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Two for the Money","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1675624729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmZiZjFlZjAtNmJkNS00N2NiLWJmMzMtYjMxMmNlMzc1ODNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmZiZjFlZjAtNmJkNS00N2NiLWJmMzMtYjMxMmNlMzc1ODNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000190/","name":"Matthew McConaughey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000623/","name":"Rene Russo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0142286/","name":"D.J. Caruso"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0866413/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0101337/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0319659/","name":"Dan Gilroy"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Black Rain
Czarny deszcz
Black Rain
programme.desc:
Black Rain: Directed by Ridley Scott. With Michael Douglas, Andy Garcia, Ken Takakura, Kate Capshaw. Two NYC cops arrest a Yakuza member and must escort him when he's extradited to Japan." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0096933/","name":"Black Rain","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTkwMDA2MmQtODI1MS00MGI5LWE5YTktMTUzYzY4ZDZjMmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjY3MjUzNDk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two NYC cops arrest a Yakuza member and must escort him when he's extradited to Japan.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0096933/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CuriosityKilledShawn"},"dateCreated":"2007-02-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ultra-moody cop fiction.","reviewBody":"I saw this film on crappy pan and scan VHS when I was about 12 and I didn't really understand it and I wasn't really up on Ridley Scott's work. As a result, the impact of the film was somewhat lost on me. I was expecting an action film instead of a character drama with lots of police procedure. But now, older and wiser and with a brand new Blu Ray of the movie, I am finally able to appreciate how clever the film is.

The story unfortunately IS riddled with 80s Cop Movie clichés and goes through quite a lot of familiar motions. But if you see past that you'll appreciate the immense atmosphere and mood that Ridley Scott piles on. Simply put, Michael Douglas is Nick Conklin, a bad cop (pretty much the exact same character in Basic Instinct) who drag races on his superbike to pay alimony and pinches drug money instead of turning it in for evidence. Enjoying lunch with partner Charlie (Andy Garcia) in a steakhouse in New York's meat-packing district, they just happen to witness a Yakuza execution by wanted Japanese criminal Sato (Yusaku Matsuda, who was dying of cancer during filming and didn't tell anyone). After a quick punch-up and shoot-out they find themselves chaperoning Sato back to Osaka. But when they arrive there he manages to escape, leaving them embarrassed with lots of questions to answer.

Nick and Charlie find themselves in a very foreign and intolerant world and recapturing Sato proves to be difficult in many ways. Not the least of which is Japan's alienating culture (from an NYPD point of view) and rigid rules. Nonetheless, Nick is determined to catch Sato and restore his honor.

Like I said, the atmosphere of the film is overwhelming, which is really all the film needs. The clichés and stereotypes don't matter so much when you are involved this much. Hans Zimmer (his first film with Ridley Scott) provides a deeply emotional and very melodic score that'll be rattling around in your head for days. It's a shame it's never had a comprehensive CD release, as it's one of Zimmer's most impressive efforts.

You could call it a pretty 80s movies, but I still do feel that it holds up pretty well today. As one of Ridley Scott's more forgotten works, it's well worth checking out.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52384,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1989-09-22","keywords":"japan,yakuza,police chase,osaka japan,counterfeit","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000140/","name":"Michael Douglas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000412/","name":"Andy Garcia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0847264/","name":"Ken Takakura"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000631/","name":"Ridley Scott"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035763/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0015234/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0093271/","name":"Craig Bolotin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0507863/","name":"Warren Lewis"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

The Rainmaker: Directed by Joseph Anthony. With Burt Lancaster, Katharine Hepburn, Wendell Corey, Lloyd Bridges. That some of this movie appears hokey, over-the-top and unbelievable is perfect. It requires the same leap of faith for the movie viewer as the characters must take in the story.

The script for this movie is brilliantly written and as timely today as it ever was. The casting and acting are wonderful.

This movie makes a very valuable point: It's not a con when you help someone believe in herself. programme.title: Christmas with the Kranks
Święta Last Minute
Christmas with the Kranks
programme.desc: Christmas with the Kranks: Directed by Joe Roth. With Tim Allen, Jamie Lee Curtis, Dan Aykroyd, M. Emmet Walsh. With their daughter, Blair, away, Luther and Nora Krank decide to skip Christmas all together until she decides to come home, causing an uproar when they have to celebrate it at the last minute." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0388419/","name":"Christmas with the Kranks","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMDMxODEwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzM4OTc2._V1_.jpg","description":"With their daughter, Blair, away, Luther and Nora Krank decide to skip Christmas all together until she decides to come home, causing an uproar when they have to celebrate it at the last minute.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0388419/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"the-movie-guy"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Have a Merry slapstick Christmas","reviewBody":"For the first time, Luther Krank (Tim Allen) and his wife Nora (Jamie Lee Curtis) are about to celebrate the holidays without their daughter Blair (Julie Gonzalo), who has just left for the Peace Corps in Peru. Luther sees a Caribbean cruise poster in a Chicago travel agency window, and he begins to plan the trip. First he must see how he will pay for the trip, so he comes up with an idea that if they skipped Christmas, they could go. He will save money by not buying a tree, having a party, or putting up decorations. The neighbors think he is crazy and want him to at least put Frosty the Snowman on his roof for the local decoration contest. The battle begins between the Kranks and their neighbors. Then Blair calls and tells her parents that she is flying home for Christmas with her fiancée. They have twenty-four hours to put up all the decorations and prepare for the Christmas party. The movie was based on a John Grisham book, 'Skipping Christmas'. It is a cute Christmas story with a lot of funny slapstick sketches. It reminds you of the Chevy Chase movie, 'National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation'. Tim Allen does a great job in several comedy scenes, especially, the scenes where he gets bowtox injections in his face and the suntan scene. (Columbia Pictures, Run time 1:39, Rated PG) (5/10)"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45929,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2004-11-24","keywords":"bikini,christmas,cat,singing,arrest","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Christmas with the Kranks","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2092826905","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk0MTdmNTItZTQwMC00MTk5LTkyZTYtYjdjMGNkMzBkZjEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk0MTdmNTItZTQwMC00MTk5LTkyZTYtYjdjMGNkMzBkZjEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000741/","name":"Tim Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000130/","name":"Jamie Lee Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005387/","name":"Joe Roth"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0125564/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001300/","name":"John Grisham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

Wyobraź sobie
Imagine That
programme.desc: Imagine That: Directed by Karey Kirkpatrick. With Eddie Murphy, Thomas Haden Church, Yara Shahidi, Ronny Cox. A financial executive who can't stop his career downspiral is invited into his daughter's imaginary world, where solutions to his problems await." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0780567/","name":"Imagine That","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIwMjgwMjg4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTU2ODkzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A financial executive who can't stop his career downspiral is invited into his daughter's imaginary world, where solutions to his problems await.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0780567/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Gordon-11"},"dateCreated":"2009-10-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fun but forgettable","reviewBody":"This film is about a high ranking executive in a financial corporation, who falls into his daughter's fantasy world.\n\n"Imagine That" is a fun movie that is suitable for both adults and children. Eddie Murphy does a good job to entertain, but this time he dances and sings with his daughter. It is a refreshing change that his movie is without any gross or crude humour. In between the fun scenes, it explores family relationships and how people prioritise their loved ones. It is particularly sad that parents nowadays may be emotionally distant from their children because of heavy work commitments, which is so well portrayed in this film. Of course, "Imagine That" does not dwell in such a topic, but instead is a forgettable comedy."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14499,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2009-08-05","keywords":"movie flop,two word title,slimehouse,sleepover,competition","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Imagine That","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1263272729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyMDUxMzUxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTk5NzYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyMDUxMzUxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTk5NzYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A financial executive (Murphy) who can't stop his career downspiral is invited into his daughter's imaginary world, where solutions to his problems await."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000552/","name":"Eddie Murphy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002006/","name":"Thomas Haden Church"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2780578/","name":"Yara Shahidi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0456732/","name":"Karey Kirkpatrick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0004265/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117723/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0558533/","name":"Chris Matheson"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

Eddie Murphy does a good job to entertain, but this time he dances and sings with his daughter. It is a refreshing change that his movie is without any gross or crude humour. In between the fun scenes, it explores family relationships and how people prioritise their loved ones. It is particularly sad that parents nowadays may be emotionally distant from their children because of heavy work commitments, which is so well portrayed in this film. Of course, "Imagine That" does not dwell in such a topic, but instead is a forgettable comedy.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14499,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2009-08-05","keywords":"movie flop,two word title,slimehouse,sleepover,competition","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Imagine That","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1263272729","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyMDUxMzUxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTk5NzYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyMDUxMzUxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTk5NzYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A financial executive (Murphy) who can't stop his career downspiral is invited into his daughter's imaginary world, where solutions to his problems await.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000552/","name":"Eddie Murphy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002006/","name":"Thomas Haden Church","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2780578/","name":"Yara Shahidi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0456732/","name":"Karey Kirkpatrick"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0004265/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117723/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0558533/","name":"Chris Matheson"],"duration":"PT1H47M"</script><metacontent="
